title: Project Manager, Scada & EMS (Australia)
description: ABOUT POWER FACTORSPower Factors is a software and solutions provider leading the next generation of clean energy with Unity, one of the most extensive and widely deployed renewable energy management suites (REMS) in the market.

raw.title: Project Manager, Scada & EMS (Australia)
raw.excerpt: ABOUT POWER FACTORSPower Factors is a software and solutions provider leading the next generation of clean energy with Unity, one of the most extensive and widely deployed renewable energy management suites (REMS) in the market.
raw.description:
ABOUT POWER FACTORS

Power Factors is a software and solutions provider leading the next generation of clean energy with Unity, one of the most extensive and widely deployed renewable energy management suites (REMS) in the market. With over 300 GW of wind, solar, and energy storage assets managed worldwide across more than 600 customers and 18,000 sites, Power Factors manages 25% of the world’s renewable energy data.*

Power Factors’ Unity REMS supports the entire energy value chain, from monitoring and controls to market analytics. The company’s suite of open, data-driven applications empowers renewable energy stakeholders to collaborate, automate critical workflows, and make more informed decisions to maximize asset returns. Energy stakeholders receive end-to-end support, including solutions for SCADA & PPC, centralized monitoring, performance management, commercial asset management, and field service management.

With deep domain expertise, AI-powered insights are delivered at scale so businesses can optimize assets, unlock growth, and make smarter decisions as the world rapidly transitions to clean energy. Power Factors fights climate change with code.

* Outside China and India

ABOUT THE ROLE

We are seeking an experienced Project Manager with a positive track record able to coordinate internal and external resources to support fulfilment of utility scale SCADA projects (projects covering region: Spain, Portugal, rest of west Europe, and Latin America). The Project Manager will coordinate with sales staff, technical managers, support personnel, suppliers, clients and other stakeholders to manage fulfillment of Powerfactor’s utility scale projects. The Project Manager’s primary responsibility is to oversee projects from sales through commissioning, ensure successful handoffs between cross-functional teams and serve as the primary client interface for SCADA systems for Renewable Energy Sources. The successful applicant will work collaboratively with local team members, as well as interact on a regular basis with other company resources, experts and management located in other parts of the world. This is achieved through the candidate’s natural collaborative spirit, tactical communications, prompt and timely execution of deliverables and is measured by the customer experiences from their interactions and business cooperation.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Coordinate and enforce SCADA project execution plans, from sales to commissioning
  • Own project timelines, deliverables, invoicing milestones, and closure
  • Maintain daily client communication and ensure timely follow-up on requests
  • Adopt and enforce company processes and project/task management tools
  • Collaborate with clients to define and clarify scope, deliverables, and milestones
  • Maintain and update project plans, with a focus on billing and timelines
  • Work closely with technical managers, engineers, subcontractors, and regional stakeholders
  • Plan and monitor internal workflows and resource allocations
  • Oversee handoffs to support teams and evaluate project outcomes
  • Define scope of work, develop statements of work, task breakdowns, and milestone plans
  • Coordinate comprehensive and accurate project documentation
  • Participate in coordination meetings, presenting status updates and resolving issues
  • Identify project risks, assumptions, and constraints, and develop mitigation plans
  • Identify and manage out-of-scope tasks, and lead change order execution
  • Ensure quality assurance across all project deliverables
  • Enforce HSE (Health, Safety, and Environmental) standards when teams are onsite

WHAT YOU WILL NEED TO BE SUCCESSFUL

We are looking for a proactive and communicative team member who thrives in fast-paced environments and enjoys solving complex problems. You’re energized by working on impactful projects, collaborating across departments, and learning every day.

Skills & Experience

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Electrical, Automation, or Power Engineering (or related field)
  • Minimum 5 years of experience in a similar project management role
  • Background in renewable energy, power systems, or SCADA integration
  • Deep understanding of power grids and renewable infrastructure
  • Proven ability to manage competing priorities and complex project portfolios
  • Strong project management skills and familiarity with formal methodologies
  • Hands-on experience delivering projects on time and within scope
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Project, Jira, and Google Workspace tools
  • Comfortable interfacing with various levels of client engineering and leadership teams
  • Excellent communication skills in English (verbal and written); additional languages are a plus

LIFE @ POWER FACTORS

We are an agile software development company – big enough to make an impact, but small enough to move quickly and execute in a growing industry. We are a team of bold and ingenious talents driven by results. We are passionate about making the world a better place. We seek fierce and humble people to help us achieve our ambitious plan.

WHY JOIN US

By joining the Power Factors team, you’ll be part of a dynamic group of innovative and driven individuals dedicated to making a positive impact. Every day, your work will directly contribute to advancing clean energy solutions and supporting global sustainability initiatives. Our culture runs deep and shows up in how we work together - committed, conscientious and collaborative. With many opportunities for professional growth, Power Factors is here to support your development as we lead the charge in transforming the energy industry.

WE ARE AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

Power Factors is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to engaging a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive culture. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status.

title: Amazon PPC Strategist
description: ﻿Our client, The Bedrock Agency, is looking for an experienced and dedicated individual to join their team as a PPC Strategist for a full time remote job.

raw.title: Amazon PPC Strategist
raw.excerpt: ﻿Our client, The Bedrock Agency, is looking for an experienced and dedicated individual to join their team as a PPC Strategist for a full time remote job.
raw.description:
﻿Our client, The Bedrock Agency, is looking for an experienced and dedicated individual to join their team as a PPC Strategist for a full time remote job. You will be responsible for daily optimization, account management, keyword research and daily, weekly and monthly analytics reporting.

If you have an analytical mindset, extensive experience in PPC management, brand promotion, and solid experience with PPC automation software, you are result-driven and learn non-stop, we would love to hear from you!

The Bedrock agency is built on experts that help grow brands on Amazon.com. At The Bedrock Agency, we only succeed if our clients succeed, therefore we drive profitable business outcomes for Amazon brands. ﻿Our advanced tools use data to find the most exciting possibilities, track customer needs, and provide growth results.

Expectations

﻿A successful candidate will have a proven track record in the following areas:

  • A fundamental understanding of Amazon Pay-per-Click advertising
  • An understanding of Search Engine Optimization (SEO) and listing optimization
  • Analyzing data for trends and opportunities
  • Experience working in remote teams
  • Familiarity with using task management systems
  • A perpetual learner
  • A strong interest in digital marketing and advertising

Responsibilities

﻿As an Advertising Strategist you will:﻿

  • Manage all aspects of Amazon PPC
  • Create, manage, and optimize PPC campaigns through PPC automation software to increase sales and improve our brand's market presence
  • ﻿Utilize Amazon's Brand Analytics capabilities to enhance Sponsored brand content that drives customer engagement and conversion.
  • Use PPC automation software and current keyword research methods for data analysis, monitoring, and campaign optimization.
  • Stay up-to-date with Amazon's policies, algorithms, and customer trends, and adjust strategies accordingly.
  • Analyze product performance and rankings, order defect rate, customer feedback, and return rates to identify growth opportunities and areas for improvement.
  • Work closely with our executive team to create effective promotions and marketing strategies.

Qualifications:

  • 2+ years Amazon experience
  • 2+ years of Amazon advertising experience
  • Amazon Advertising Certified (Not Required but a Plus)
  • Deep understanding of Amazons systems, Seller Central, FBA rules, and product listing strategies.
  • Proven track record in Amazon PPC management and optimization.
  • Experience with PPC automation software and keyword research tools.
  • Familiarity with Amazon SEO best practices and keyword research tools.
  • Demonstrated success in managing high volume SKU count and inventory management.
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to analyze raw data, draw conclusions, and develop actionable recommendations. Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to adjust to the ever-changing digital marketplaces
  • Desire to test and learn new tools and technologies

description: Rejoignez Exposant 3 (E3) : La puissance de l’humain au cœur de la technologie !

raw.title: Expert en architecture d'intégration de solutions
raw.excerpt: Rejoignez Exposant 3 (E3) : La puissance de l’humain au cœur de la technologie !
raw.description:
Rejoignez Exposant 3 (E3) : La puissance de l’humain au cœur de la technologie !

Exposant 3 est une firme de services-conseils en gestion des affaires et technologies de l'information, dédiée à accompagner les entreprises et organismes dans leur transformation numérique et organisationnelle.

👉 Votre carrière chez Exposant 3

Nous croyons fermement en une gestion saine et humaine, où la confiance, la compétence, et le plaisir de réussir ensemble sont au centre de nos valeurs.

Nous vous offrons bien plus qu’un simple emploi : rejoignez une équipe innovante où l’intelligence artificielle, l’automatisation des processus, et la modernisation technologique font partie du quotidien. Chez Exposant 3, nous mettons l’humain au cœur de tout ce que nous entreprenons.

🚀 Notre vision ?

Vous permettre de déployer "la puissance de l’humain exposant 3" :

  • La puissance de l’individu : Un environnement où votre engagement est valorisé.
  • La puissance de l’équipe : Une collaboration forte où l’entraide et les réussites sont partagées.
  • La puissance de l’entreprise : Une vision commune pour des objectifs ambitieux et collectifs.

Si vous cherchez à évoluer dans un cadre dynamique et à contribuer à des projets d’envergure, tout en grandissant au sein d’une entreprise humaine, innovante et en pleine croissance, alors Exposant 3 est fait pour vous !

Nous cherchons notre futur Expert en architecture d'intégration de solutions en lien avec le bureau numérique pour rejoindre nos équipes.

🎯 Vos missions

  • Conseil stratégique : Offrir des conseils aux gestionnaires, du chef de service au PDG, sur l'utilisation stratégique des services numériques pour trouver des solutions liées aux technologies de l’information.
  • Collaboration sur des projets d’évolution : Participer à l’évolution des solutions numériques inscrites au Plan d’investissement de la VPEN - volet TI.
  • Réalisation de dossiers d’opportunité et d’affaires : Élaborer des dossiers pour des projets majeurs ou des dossiers de migration et d’évolution ayant une incidence majeure sur la clientèle ou plusieurs de ses vice-présidences afin de permettre à la haute direction de la Société de prendre des décisions stratégiques sur des solutions en services numériques et d'autoriser les investissements requis pour leur réalisation et leur implantation.
  • Mandats de positionnement ou d’orientation : Réaliser des mandats sur des préoccupations stratégiques de la Société ou gouvernementales afin que la Société se positionne face à ces préoccupations et précise sa contribution.
  • Dossiers de veille stratégique : Proposer aux gestionnaires des solutions novatrices susceptibles d'améliorer l’efficience de l’organisation.

📝 Votre profil

  1. Posséder au moins quinze (15) années d’expérience en technologies de l’information.
  2. Parmi ces quinze (15) années, avoir au moins cinq (5) années d'expérience dans des mandats liés au bureau numérique.
  3. Au cours des quinze (15) dernières années, et plus spécifiquement au cours des cinq (5) dernières années, avoir rédigé, en tant qu’expert en architecture d’intégration de solutions liées au bureau numérique, les dossiers suivants dans des organismes d’envergure comparable du client. Les expériences présentées doivent avoir été réalisées dans le cadre de projets majeurs d’entreprise ou de dossiers de migration ou d’évolution de solutions en lien avec le bureau numérique ayant une incidence majeure sur la clientèle de l’organisme ou dans plusieurs de ses vice-présidences :
    • Au moins trois (3) dossiers d’opportunité, d’orientation, d’avis-conseils, d’études ou d’avis concernant des solutions infonuagiques de Microsoft 365.
    • Au moins un (1) dossier d’affaires lié à la conception ou à l’évolution de solutions infonuagiques de Microsoft 365.
  4. Au cours des quinze (15) dernières années, et plus spécifiquement au cours des cinq (5) dernières années, avoir réalisé, en tant qu’expert en architecture d’intégration de solutions liées au bureau numérique, au moins trois (3) processus de présentation de dossiers stratégiques à de hauts dirigeants tels que vice-président, sous-ministre adjoint, sous-ministre, président-directeur général. Les expériences présentées doivent avoir été réalisées dans le cadre de projets majeurs d’entreprise ou de dossiers de migration ou d’évolution de solutions en lien avec le bureau numérique ayant une incidence majeure sur la clientèle ou plusieurs vice-présidences.
Attentes souhaitables
  1. Avoir réalisé au moins un (1) mandat d’une durée minimale de deux (2) mois impliquant l’utilisation des produits en intelligence artificielle liés à l’environnement de collaboration Microsoft 365 au cours des trois (3) dernières années.
  2. Avoir réalisé au moins un (1) mandat d’une durée minimale d’un (1) mois de veille technologique sur des solutions émergentes en lien avec l’infonuagique ou le bureau numérique pour des organisations comparables à la Société au cours des trois (3) dernières années.

description: 1.  Role OverviewMercor is contracting experts in the humanities to support a project focused on analytical and interpretive writing across disciplines such as history, philosophy, and cultural studies.

raw.title: History / Humanities Specialist
raw.excerpt: 1.  Role OverviewMercor is contracting experts in the humanities to support a project focused on analytical and interpretive writing across disciplines such as history, philosophy, and cultural studies.
raw.description:
1. Role Overview

Mercor is contracting experts in the humanities to support a project focused on analytical and interpretive writing across disciplines such as history, philosophy, and cultural studies. This work involves synthesizing arguments from complex texts, analyzing changes across time periods, and connecting historical events to broader social dynamics. Freelancers will help distill nuanced reasoning for use in advanced AI training.

2. Key Responsibilities

  • Analyze humanities texts for interpretive depth and argumentative structure

  • Synthesize themes across time periods, movements, or cultural contexts

  • Interpret primary sources and connect them to broader historical or philosophical arguments

  • Evaluate causal reasoning in topics such as reform, identity, and power dynamics

  • Provide concise, well-structured written explanations grounded in source material

3. Ideal Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree or higher in History, Philosophy, Cultural Studies, or a related field

  • Proven experience in academic writing, source interpretation, or historical analysis

  • Strong ability to connect abstract concepts with concrete historical examples

  • Excellent writing, reasoning, and analytical skills

  • Comfortable working independently in a remote, detail-oriented setting

4. More About the Opportunity

  • Remote and asynchronous — set your own schedule

  • Expected commitment: ~10–20 hours/week

  • Well-suited for academic researchers, educators, or freelance writers

5. Compensation & Contract Terms

  • $45/hour

  • You’ll be classified as an independent contractor

  • Paid weekly via Stripe Connect

  • US-Based

6. Application Process

  • Submit your resume to get started

  • You may be asked to complete a brief interpretive writing assessment

  • We typically follow up within 3–5 business days

7. About Mercor

  • Mercor is a talent marketplace that connects top experts with leading AI labs and research organizations

  • Our investors include Benchmark, General Catalyst, Adam D’Angelo, Larry Summers, and Jack Dorsey

  • Thousands of professionals across domains like law, creatives, engineering, and research have joined Mercor to work on frontier projects shaping the next era of AI

raw.description:
Our client, a well-established multinational D2C e-commerce company operating in the USA selling high quality pet products (supplements) is looking for an experienced professional to fill an immediate opening for an Social Media Accounts Manager for a full-time remote job.


﻿﻿You will be responsible for managing the company's overall social media strategy, execution, and community engagement to grow our reach, increase awareness of our products, and position our company as the industry leader.
The successful candidate will focus on curating, sourcing and scheduling social media content for our social media platforms and channels; listening to and engaging with our audience on social media; and measuring and reporting on social media analytics and performance.

If you have command of best practices and trends in social media, enjoy being creative, and understand how to both build and engage a digital audience, we would love to hear from you! ﻿

About You:﻿﻿

  • Have 3 years or related experience
  • Love to analyze numbers and identify new social media strategies.
  • Have experience in developing social media strategies for physical products;
  • Are good in written and spoken English;
  • Self-motivated team player who is committed to help the company growth and evolvement (we are looking for a person who will become a part of the company, not only its employee);

Responsibilities:

  • create and manage social media strategy for such USA social platforms FB, IG, Amazon, Snapchat, TikTok, etc. ;
  • analyze and report on social media performance to improve the company's strategy and overall effectiveness;
  • gain loyal audience in all available channels;
  • sell products through social media channels;
  • launch new products on social media;
  • work with influencers: search for new ones for cooperation and audience growth;
  • communicate with potential customers;

Your advantage will be:

  • experience working with companies selling on Amazon, Snapchat, TikTok, Reddit, etc.
  • deep understanding of the US market and experience in working with it
  • experience with similar products and brands (supplements, animals products)

You have an interest in natural products and healthy living and you like animals.

Our benefits:

    • Work for a Market-proven, fast-growing company
    • Competitive salary and bonus opportunities
    • Friendly International start-up environment
    • Paid trainings and courses
    • Be a part of something bigger, where you can have autonomy over your work
    • Fully remote work and flexible working hours (work from whatever place)

title: Product Development Manager
description: Our client, a dynamic Amazon FBA business, offering eco-friendly Home & Kitchen products, is seeking a Product Development Manager to lead their efforts in developing new products and improving existing ones.

raw.title: Product Development Manager
raw.excerpt: Our client, a dynamic Amazon FBA business, offering eco-friendly Home & Kitchen products, is seeking a Product Development Manager to lead their efforts in developing new products and improving existing ones.
raw.description:
Our client, a dynamic Amazon FBA business, offering eco-friendly Home & Kitchen products, is seeking a Product Development Manager to lead their efforts in developing new products and improving existing ones.

This role involves close collaboration with Brand Managers and Sourcing Agents to ensure the products meet the evolving needs of the customers and maintain competitive advantage.

About the company:

It is a fast-growing brand developing several new green and sustainable products for eco-conscious consumers. Currently, the company sells mostly on Amazon, but it also operates on Shopify and Walmart. It has over 200,000 customers in 7 countries (USA, Canada, Mexico, UK, Germany, Japan, China). The company just partnered up with a sales team in the US who will work on getting its products in physical retail stores.

This work is changing the world here because his e-commerce brand is set to positively impact the lives of thousands of eco-conscious people who choose to use the companys eco-friendly products, saving tons of plastic waste and CO2 every year. The company is also committed to environmental and social causes, having planted 10,000 trees and financing plastic waste collection from the oceans through our partners at Clean Hub.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Lead cross-functional teams to develop new products and enhance existing product lines.
  • Manage the entire product development lifecycle from concept through design, prototyping, testing, and market introduction.
  • Analyze market trends and customer feedback to identify opportunities for new products and product improvements.
  • Work closely with sourcing agents to identify and evaluate suppliers, ensuring product quality and cost-effectiveness.
  • Coordinate with Brand Managers to align product development with brand strategy and market positioning.
  • Prepare detailed product development plans, including timelines, budgets, and resource requirements.
  • Monitor and report on product development progress, including challenges and milestones.
  • Monitor product performance, identify risks, issues, and problems, escalate as appropriate, proposing mitigation plans to overcome obstacles.
  • Drive a focus on design and cost to ensure the delivery of excellent products to our consumers at valued price points.
  • Be responsible for product documentation including specifications, manuals, packaging, case studies, product comparisons, competitor analysis, and user stories. Be an expert with respect to the competition.
  • Ensure compliance with all relevant regulations and quality standards.

Qualifications:

  • Minimum of 2 years experience in product development in an e-commerce company selling on Amazon
  • Strong project management skills with a proven ability to lead cross-functional teams.
  • Excellent analytical skills and the ability to think critically.
  • Engineering background or strong understanding of manufacturing and sourcing processes.
  • Creativity and innovation for improving product design and functionality.
  • Ability to work independently.
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively with diverse teams.
  • Experience working with international markets and suppliers from China is highly desirable.
  • Advanced English.

What We Offer:

  • Fully remote and full-time role.
  • Paid time off.
  • Quarterly bonuses.
  • Professional growth opportunities, such as managing staff members and growing your skill set.
  • Competitive and timely salary.
  • Opportunity to work remotely in an international company.
  • Dynamic, creative work environments.
  • Flexible schedule.

title: Spontanansökan Koordinator
description: Om Nova PsykiatriNova Psykiatri grundades med en vision om att revolutionera psykiatrin och behandling av psykiska ohälsa.

raw.title: Spontanansökan Koordinator
raw.excerpt: Om Nova PsykiatriNova Psykiatri grundades med en vision om att revolutionera psykiatrin och behandling av psykiska ohälsa.
raw.description:
Om Nova Psykiatri

Nova Psykiatri grundades med en vision om att revolutionera psykiatrin och behandling av psykiska ohälsa. Vi strävar efter att erbjuda en modern och patientcentrerad vårdupplevelse. Vi vill erbjuda bästa Europas bästa utredning och behandling för personer med ADHD, Autism och annan psykiatrisk problematik.

Dagens psykiatri präglas av traditionella metoder och ett ofta långsamt arbetssätt, där tekniska framsteg och patientens behov sällan står i fokus. Många patienter har svårt att navigera i ett komplext offentligt system eller vänder sig till stora vårdgivare där de riskerar att bli en anonym siffra i mängden. Vi har valt att göra saker annorlunda genom att sätta patienten i centrum och erbjuda psykiatrisk vård med en femstjärnig service. Vår strategi bygger på patientupplevelse, kvalitet och effektivitet, där vi använder modern teknik och innovativa arbetsmetoder för att ständigt förbättra och utveckla vår verksamhet.

Vårt engagerade team är kärnan i vår verksamhet och består främst av psykologer, läkare och sjuksköterskor. Nova Psykiatri grundades i januari 2024 och har idag cirka 30 medarbetare – och vi växer snabbt. Nu söker vi fler drivna personer som vill vara med och forma framtidens psykiatri tillsammans med oss. Vi lägger mycket fokus på att anställa Sveriges duktigaste medarbetare, men även att folk ska trivas bättre här än någon annanstans.

Novas vision är att visa hur psykiatri kan fungera, för såväl patienter som för medarbetare. Vi tror det går att göra mycket bättre. Vi drivs av att hela tiden förbättra patientnöjdheten, hålla hög kvalitet, och samtidigt höja effektiviteten genom minskad administration. Vi tror att vi når allt detta genom att ha kul tillsammans, våga göra misstag, samt genom att våga sträva mot att vara bäst på det vi gör.

Om rollen

Vi är ett företag i tillväxt med ett fortlöpande behov av att rekrytera fler duktiga koordinatorer på deltid (8-20 timmar i veckan) som vill bidra till en förstklassig patientupplevelse. Går att arbeta på distans från valfri plats i Sverige.

Exempel på arbetsuppgifter:

  • Ansvara för att boka in patienter på tider för utredningar och medicinering.
  • Besvara patienter via telefon, mail och chatt.
  • Ha dialog med övriga delar av organisationen för att identifiera behov och utvecklingsmöjligheter inom administrationsområdet.

Stor del av arbetet sker alltså i samtal med andra via telefon. Du kan även komma att arbeta med uppgifter som remisshantering, uppföljning av patientbokningar och stöd i administrativa rutiner samt att bidra till att våra processer blir ännu smidigare.

Vem vi söker

Vi söker dig som har följande egenskaper:

- Social och serviceinriktad: Du är väldigt duktig på att snabbt bygga tillit med andra och få andra att tycka om dig, då du spelar en central roll i att bemöta patienter och samarbetspartners via telefon samt mejl. Du drivs av att göra det lilla extra för att göra alla du pratar med positiva och nöjda.

- Driven: Du gillar att hålla ett högt tempo och få saker gjort snabbt.

- Strukturerad: Du är duktig på att planera och skapa struktur med en god förmåga att hantera flera uppgifter samtidigt.

Tidigare erfarenhet är inget krav – vi tror på rätt person med rätt inställning. Om du har tidigare erfarenhet tror vi det kan vara fördelaktigt med erfarenhet inom sälj eller service.

Vad vi erbjuder

  • Ett roligt och meningsfullt arbete där du är med och skapar framtidens psykiatri.
  • Du är med och skapar förutsättningarna för Sveriges bästa arbetsplats!
  • Möjlighet att arbeta i en dynamisk och innovativ miljö.
  • En öppen och inkluderande arbetskultur där vi tycker om att ha roligt tillsammans på och utanför jobbet.


    Skicka gärna in din ansökan – vi hör av oss om vi ser en möjlighet som matchar din profil!

title: Staff Engineer
description: Staff EngineerRemote OpportunityWhy This Role MattersThe Staff Engineer plays a critical role in shaping how Reveleer builds and scales its products.

raw.title: Staff Engineer
raw.excerpt: Staff EngineerRemote OpportunityWhy This Role MattersThe Staff Engineer plays a critical role in shaping how Reveleer builds and scales its products.
raw.description:
Staff Engineer

Remote Opportunity

Why This Role Matters

The Staff Engineer plays a critical role in shaping how Reveleer builds and scales its products. We are modernizing our stack, expanding distributed development, and increasing our focus on data and AI. This role provides the senior technical leadership and hands on execution needed to support the 2026 roadmap and beyond.

This is not an advisory role. We need someone who can design patterns, write code, review code, and actively guide teams. The Staff Engineer leads through building, teaching, and raising the engineering bar across the organization.

Why Join Reveleer

Reveleer builds value-based care solutions that help health plans and providers collaborate more effectively across quality, risk adjustment, and member engagement. We are investing heavily in modern data practices and AI-driven workflows to scale our products and deliver better outcomes for our customers. As a Staff Engineer, you will directly influence how our platform evolves and play a key role in helping the organization scale.

If you are hands on, adaptable, and motivated by driving real product outcomes, we would love to talk.

What Success Looks Like

  • Owns and solves some of the most difficult technical problems in the company
  • Plays a major role in helping Engineering meet commitments by proactively noticing gaps and jumping in where needed
  • Improves reliability, performance, and delivery speed in visible, measurable ways

Helps others get things done

  • Helps establish a culture of learning by mentoring engineers
  • Makes other engineers more effective through clear patterns, reviews, and hands on collaboration
  • Is a go to partner for product and engineering leaders when work is complex or high risk

Build the future today

  • Brings deep experience across multiple technologies and applies that experience to Reveleer’s platform and products
  • Initiates and leads key cross cutting projects that move the architecture and codebase forward
  • Ensures technical decisions align with the company’s roadmap

What You Will Do

  • Design, develop and evolve the core technical patterns that shape how Reveleer builds software
  • Write high quality code, prototypes, reference implementations, and reusable components
  • Provide hands on technical guidance through pair programming, design reviews, and code reviews as needed
  • Lead design for distributed systems, cloud native patterns, API development, and multi-tenant SaaS
  • Partner with data and AI teams to integrate applications with pipelines, analytics, and ML or LLM services
  • Identify performance bottlenecks, technical risks, and architectural gaps and drive pragmatic solutions
  • Work closely with product leadership to ensure the technical foundation accelerates roadmap delivery

What Makes You a Great Fit

  • Deep experience as a hands-on staff level engineer working in distributed systems at scale
  • Strong background in cloud native engineering, preferably AWS/Azure, microservices, and SaaS patterns.
  • Experience building or supporting data and AI workloads, including ML or LLM integrations
  • Demonstrated depth and expertise in designing and implementing robust solutions using C#, .NET, and SQL Server, with a strong understanding of best practices for scalable, secure, and high-performance applications.
  • Ability to turn complex technical challenges into clear, actionable solutions
  • Strong communication, collaboration, and mentorship skills
Salary: $180k - $200k

title: LATAM Marketing Manager
description: We exist to create positive change for people and the planet.

raw.title: LATAM Marketing Manager
raw.excerpt: We exist to create positive change for people and the planet.
raw.description:
We exist to create positive change for people and the planet. Join us and make a difference too!

Job Title: LATAM Marketing Manager

Location: Mexico - remote

BSI’s Assurance division is hiring a LATAM Marketing Manager to own the end-to-end go-to-market strategy across Latin America with a primary focus on Mexico.

In this role, you will translate global strategy into high-impact, localized programs that fuel pipeline and revenue across System Certification, Training, and ISA, while leading our regional Center of Excellence (CoE) for campaign development, design, and digital execution.

You’ll also serve regionally as a Theme Lead for Quality & Mobility, setting the bar for messaging and integrated campaigns used across the Americas.

If you thrive in a matrixed, fast-paced environment and can flex from strategy to hands-on execution, this role is for you!

What you’ll own:

  • LATAM GTM leadership: Build and deliver the marketing plan for Latin America (with Mexico emphasis) aligned to commercial targets and sector priorities.

  • Localization that wins: Adapt global/regional campaigns to local language, culture, regulation, and buyer behavior.

  • Partner with the business: Collaborate effectively with Sales and Training to shape marketing strategies that move pipeline and revenue.

How you’ll lead:

  • Team & CoE leadership: Lead, coach, and develop the LATAM marketing team and Regional CoE; set priorities, raise skills, and ensure high-quality execution.

  • Operational excellence: Drive clarity, workload management, and accountability using project tools (e.g., Workfront); uphold brand, compliance, and governance standards.

How you’ll execute:

  • Full-funnel, integrated campaigns: Orchestrate email, web, SEO/SEM, paid media, social, events/webinars, and ABM to create demand and accelerate conversions.

  • Digital & demand-gen mastery: Increase engagement, improve targeting, and optimize journeys; manage lead workflows in Salesforce and Pardot (segmentation, routing, nurture).

  • Budget ownership: Plan, allocate, and track the LATAM marketing budget for maximum ROI.

  • Vendor leadership: Manage local partners (design, translation, event logistics, media buying) to deliver on brief, on brand, on budget.

  • Brand & governance: Ensure every asset meets BSI’s standards and regional regulatory requirements.

How you’ll measure success:

  • Performance & analytics: Track KPIs and attribution, maintain CRM hygiene, and partner with data teams on ROI reporting.

  • Optimize in real time: Use funnel insights to test, learn, and iterate maximizing conversion and marketing-influenced revenue.

Regional Theme Leadership (Quality & Mobility):

  • Set the bar regionally: Define positioning, content strategy, and integrated campaigns for Quality & Mobility.

  • Scale best practices: Align global messaging with LATAM needs; enable knowledge-sharing and consistent activation across countries.

What you bring:

  • Strategic clarity & executional rigor: You turn business goals into actionable programs that deliver measurable impact.

  • Proven demand gen: History of campaigns that drive MQLs, pipeline, and conversion in complex B2B environments.

  • LATAM expertise: Deep understanding of Mexico and broader LATAM buyer behavior, channels, and regulatory nuances.

  • Localization mastery: You have experience in tailoring global content/messages for maximum regional relevance.

  • Relationship builder: Confident collaborator across Sales, Training, and global teams.

  • Operational savvy: Budget management, vendor oversight, and performance reporting are second nature.

  • Martech fluency: Hands-on with Salesforce and Pardot (required); familiarity with Marketo, Workfront, SEO/SEM, paid media, and ABM tactics.

  • Organized & adaptable: Comfortable switching from big-picture strategy to precise execution; continuous-improvement mindset.

  • Segment & persona chops: You tailor narratives and offers by industry, role, and stage to move deals forward.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, Business, or related field (Master’s preferred).

  • 6+ years progressive B2B marketing experience (professional services, SaaS, or regulated industries ideal), including 3+ years leading people.

  • Proven experience executing marketing across Mexico and broader LATAM.

  • Success running multi-channel GTM in a complex organization.

  • Demonstrated ability to lead and develop marketing professionals and foster cross-functional collaboration.

  • Strong digital demand gen/ABM background and CRM-led workflows (Salesforce/Pardot required).

  • Familiarity with ISO, assurance, training, or compliance services (preferred).

  • Knowledge of Quality or Mobility sectors (preferred).

Language Requirements

A strong command of English, Spanish, and Portuguese is essential - both verbal and written. Please submit your application in English.

BSI - Your Partner in Progress

We are proud to be the business improvement company for other organizations to become more sustainable and resilient and finally to inspire trust in their products, systems, services, and the world we live in.

Headquartered in London, United Kingdom, BSI is the world's first national standards organization with more than 100 years of experience. We are a global partner for 86,000 companies and organizations in over 193 countries, offering development, auditing, certification, and training services, including innovative software solutions and cyber security expertise for all industries: from aerospace and automotive to food, construction, energy, healthcare, IT and trade sectors. Incorporated by Royal Charter, we’re truly impartial, and home to the ultimate mark of trust, the Kitemark.

Through our unique combination of consulting, training, assurance and regulatory services we bring solid and broad knowledge to every company.

If you want to contribute to this inspiring challenge, bring your open and enthusiastic mindset to our dynamic team then please apply now!

What we offer

BSI offers a competitive salary, 20-days annual leave, bank holidays, vacation bonus, medical insurance, life insurance,savings fund with company contribution, meal allowance, paid maternity leave, paid paternity leave, learning and development opportunities, and a wide range of flexible benefits that you can tailor to suit your lifestyle. 

D&I Policy

BSI is committed to ensuring the diversity of our workforce reflects that of our clients and the communities in which we operate. Our goal is to create a sense of belonging for all employees by providing opportunities to develop, grow, and engage with our global organization — all while having fun doing great work. BSI is a community where everyone can thrive.

If you require any reasonable accommodations to be made on account of a disability or impairment throughout our recruiting process, please inform your Talent Acquisition Partner.

#L1-SC1

About Us

BSI is a business improvement and standards company and for over a century BSI has been recognized for having a positive impact on organizations and society, building trust and enhancing lives.

Today BSI partners with more than 77,500 clients in 195 countries and engages with a 15,000 strong global community of experts, industry and consumer groups, organizations and governments.
Utilizing its extensive expertise in key industry sectors - including automotive, aerospace, built environment, food and retail, and healthcare - BSI delivers on its purpose by helping its clients fulfil theirs.
Living by our core values of Client-Centricity, Agility, and Collaboration, BSI provides organizations with the confidence to grow by partnering with them to tackle society’s critical issues – from climate change to building trust in digital transformation and everything in between - to accelerate progress towards a better society and a sustainable world.

BSI is an Equal Opportunity Employer dedicated to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace.

  • Identify mistranslations, unnatural phrasing, or tone inconsistencies

  • Suggest improvements to ensure natural, idiomatic usage in mainland China

  • Provide structured feedback on linguistic quality and cultural appropriateness

  • Maintain high reading speed and attention to detail across varied content types

3. Ideal Qualifications

  • Native or near-native fluency in both Chinese (Simplified) and English

  • Deep familiarity with contemporary language usage in China

  • 1+ year of experience in translation, localization, or language QA

  • Excellent reading comprehension and written communication skills

  • Strong attention to linguistic detail and cultural nuance

4. More About the Opportunity

  • Remote and asynchronous — flexible scheduling

  • Expected commitment: 10+ hours/week

  • Project duration: 1+ months, with potential for additional work

5. Compensation & Contract Terms

  • $30–35/hour depending on experience and location

  • Paid weekly via Stripe Connect

  • You’ll be classified as an independent contractor

6. Application Process

  • Submit your resume to get started

  • Complete a brief form to confirm language fluency and relevant experience

  • We’ll respond within a few days with next steps

7. About Mercor

  • Mercor is a talent marketplace that connects top experts with leading AI labs and research organizations

  • Our investors include Benchmark, General Catalyst, Adam D’Angelo, Larry Summers, and Jack Dorsey

  • Thousands of professionals across domains like law, creatives, engineering, and research have joined Mercor to work on frontier projects shaping the next era of AI

Our client, Trivium Group, is looking for an extremely dedicated individual to join their team as a skilled PPC Strategist. Your job will consist of managing and running Amazon PPC campaigns to optimize sales. You will also be responsible for keyword research, daily optimization, account management, and daily, weekly and monthly analytics reporting.‍

Trivium Group is built on experts that genuinely care about helping people scale and grow their businesses. Company's goal is to drive highly profitable business outcomes for Amazon brands with a proven approach to digital marketing, PPC management, creative services, and customer experience powered by technology and the sharpest marketing minds around the globe.

RESPONSIBILITIES:‍

Create, launch and manage Amazon PPC ads campaigns

Perform keyword research on new products to launch

Generate daily, weekly and monthly analytics reporting and communicate with the clients on a constant basis

Create graphs and tables in Excel to demonstrate PPC campaign performance

Closely monitoring PPC spending and budget to maximize profitability

Working in Excel to optimize bidding, extracting keywords and reporting‍

REQUIREMENTS:‍

Resourceful, strong communication skills - it is a client-facing role

Problem solver with a proactive approach

Experience with Amazon PPC (minimum 2 years)

Highly skilled in MS Excel and Google Sheets

High attention to details and documentation

English: at least C1

Bonus skills: Bachelors in Audit/ Analysis/ Engineering/ Marketing or Experience in Audit/ Financial Analysis or in a related field

COMPENSATION & BENEFITS:‍

Competitive salary

Semi flexible work hours

Remote work year-round

4 weeks paid vacation + sick time

Professional training

Continuous growth

Team buildings and outings

This will be a remotely administered FULL TIME [40 hr/week] position with an immediate starting date upon hire.

Working hours: 6:00-11:00 am PST are mandatory, over 3 hours are flexible. You will need to be able to accommodate different schedules and time zones. You will need a quiet workspace with fast internet, a webcam, and a microphone for video calls. This role is compensated on pure experience, and you will receive considerable levels of autonomy and ownership over your projects.

Note: If you dont think you meet all the criteria, but still are interested in the job, please apply. Nobody checks every box. We prioritize flexible candidates willing to learn and grow professionally.‍

Give yourself the chance to be part of the greatest team!

raw.title: National Account Manager (Remote - NY, NJ, CT)
raw.excerpt: Job DescriptionResponsible for managing profitable sales of the company’s products with CDW East Coast and their end users.
raw.description:
Job Description

Responsible for managing profitable sales of the company’s products with CDW East Coast and their end users. Working with Inside Sales, Marketing, Regional Product Management, and Customer Departments, create business plans, marketing calendars, and other plans and activities to complement and support the overall business strategies and objectives. Negotiate agreements, establishing pricing and maintain a strong overall relationship with customers. Interface with other departments as needed to support our accounts, proactively plan the business, and resolve any issues that may arise.

Specific Responsibilities:

  • Ability to build relationships across key accounts encompassing all levels; sales/marketing rep through executive.

  • Identify opportunities and challenges within account base and create strategies to maximize sell through, revenue, profit, and market share.

  • Understand how to communicate value propositions to key accounts and be able to present and close new business.

  • Establish and track an annual account budget, which includes sales and profits.

  • Lead team in achieving 100% of channel’s sales and profit goals.

  • Lead team to formulate a sales plan to achieve sales and profit targets for current and prospective accounts.

  • Conduct and/or receive weekly reviews of sales, RMAs, returns & allowances (R&A), quotes, promotions, sell through, inventory management, turns, forecasts, replenishment orders, backorders, and any other account activities that will impact financial results for the account(s). Resolve or delegate any issues that arise as a result of the reviews.

  • Identify, develop and negotiate terms and conditions for accounts to effectively manage overall profitability.

  • Effectively delegate and manage sales duties to exceed internal and external expectations.

  • Communicate and update sales team members with strategic company information and initiatives as required.

  • Use Salesforce.com to keep record of sales calls, including potential opportunity worth dollars, and be prepared to present that information when requested.

  • Analyze and understand industry market trends, competition, products, and pricing that may impact sales efforts and communicate this information to all sales management and other departments as necessary.

  • Drive satisfied customers while maintaining an accurate forecast and working with multiple channel partners.

  • Develop and manage sales pipeline to move a large number of strategic transactions through the sales process

  • Generating revenue and working closely with a network of Channel Partners to successfully sell the Belkin solution.

  • Define and execute sales plans for the assigned territory to meet and exceed quota through prospecting, qualifying, managing and closing sales opportunities

  • Building a business case and establish value: develop and present proposals to customers with information that demonstrates the ability of the Belkin solution to meet the customer's’ business objectives and justify the sale.

  • Drive account strategies and coordinate team selling efforts with partners to close business on a quarterly and annual basis.

  • Prospecting: proven track record of penetrating accounts, reaching decision-makers, and closing business.

  • Comfortable and confident in visiting and engaging with a wide cross spectrum of reseller, integrators and end users.

Education and Experience Requirements:

  • Four-year degree required. Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or Technology is highly desirable.

  • Four or more years experience as an Account Manager or higher sales position. Direct industry or channel experience is required, direct networking experience preferred.

  • At least three years’ experience selling working with or selling to CDW.

  • Computer literacy with a high degree of proficiency in the Microsoft Office Suite of products including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook.

  • Salesforce and Business Objects experience desired.

  • Strong verbal and written communication skills.

  • Strong presentation skills required.

  • Ability to travel domestically up to 50%

What you’re getting into

We’ve got big collaborative spaces for your big ideas, so bring an open mind and leave your suit in the closet. We all are committed to creating unique and rewarding consumer experiences. Everyone is interested in succeeding – for the team, for themselves and for the business. Cross-functionally and across the company, everyone has common goals and aspires to be their best.

You will learn something new or at least look at things differently every day. There are so many smart and creative people around that you’ll be motivated to pursue the ideal.

Team spirit is infectious. Belkin is an extremely open workplace, where communication is essential. Not every idea will be accepted, but you’ll be asked for your point of view. Innovation thrives on multiple and varied levels. At Belkin we challenge conventional wisdom and refuse to accept that something cannot be done.

Belkin is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer Disability and Veterans. We maintain a drug-free workplace.

All candidates applying for a job in the EMEA region, please review the Applicant Privacy notice HERE

Location:

New York, New York

Range for this position:

$80,000 to $100,000

Factors such as geographic location, academic credentials, relevant experience, and specific knowledge, skills and abilities will influence the actual salary offered. In addition to a competitive market-based salary, compensation also includes a performance-based bonus, and in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. Further details can be found here.

raw.description:
The Design Engineer will play a key role in designing and supporting complex Data Center infrastructure solutions. This position requires hands-on experience in Cisco Nexus environments, strong BGP knowledge, and practical experience with Python or Ansible automation.

You’ll work collaboratively with global teams to design, optimize, and maintain high-performance Data Center environments that support mission-critical systems and large-scale network operations.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Design and implement scalable Data Center network solutions using Cisco Nexus and Arista platforms.

  • Develop and review technical documentation, including design specifications and topology diagrams.

  • Support ongoing infrastructure improvements and ensure adherence to network architecture best practices.

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to align network design with business and operational goals.

  • Troubleshoot complex routing issues, focusing on BGP and related protocols.

  • Use Python and/or Ansible to automate configuration and operational tasks.

Qualifications & Requirements:

  • 5–7 years of experience in Data Center or Network Engineering roles.

  • Strong hands-on expertise with Cisco Nexus platforms.

  • Proven experience working with Arista switches and configurations.

  • Deep understanding of BGP and advanced routing concepts.

  • Experience with Python for scripting or automation; Ansible experience is a plus.

  • Cisco CCIE – Data Center certification or equivalent experience strongly preferred.

  • Excellent communication skills in English (both written and spoken).

Availability to work during U.S. business hours.

DESCRIPTIF

Ta future mission : Être garant de la satisfaction et de la fidélisation client.

Chaque jour pendant 1 mois, 💻 à distance, tu travailleras sur une problématique concrète liée à la relation client (onboarding, upsell, outils...etc) avec un expert du métier.

Après ces 4 semaines tu sauras gérer l'ensemble du cycle de vie des clients et tu rejoindras le top 10% des professionnels du secteur.

Ton quotidien sera :

1/ La formation et le suivi de tes clients

  • Former et éduquer les clients sur le produit et répondre aux questions sur différents sujets.

Si ton profil est sélectionné, nous t'appellerons pour en découvrir plus sur toi !

title: Sr Manager, Digital & Multi-Rater Platforms
description: OverviewPosition Summary:We are seeking an experienced and highly motivated Manager, Multi-Rater Platforms to lead our multi-rater deployment and standardization for Mercury.

raw.title: Sr Manager, Digital & Multi-Rater Platforms
raw.excerpt: OverviewPosition Summary:We are seeking an experienced and highly motivated Manager, Multi-Rater Platforms to lead our multi-rater deployment and standardization for Mercury.
raw.description:
Overview

Position Summary:

We are seeking an experienced and highly motivated Manager, Multi-Rater Platforms to lead our multi-rater deployment and standardization for Mercury. This role will also partner with the tech team on development and implementation efforts to ensure optimal usage of multi-raters. This role partners with sales leadership and technical product managers to set up objectives and strategies for multi-raters and drives system improvements to optimize business processes. This is a hands-on position – prior experience with managing multi-raters from a tech and business standpoint is required. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of multi-raters/insurtech, business requirements, and the ability to partner with a team of multi-rater developers, contractors, and collaborate with other IT professionals.

An in-person interview may be required during the hiring process.

Geo-Salary Information

State specific pay scales for this role are as follows:

$98,699 to $182,896 (CA, NJ, NY, WA, HI, AK, MD, CT, RI, MA)

$89,727 to $166,269 (NV, OR, AZ, CO, WY, TX, ND, MN, MO, IL, WI, FL, GA, MI, OH, VA, PA, DE, VT, NH, ME)

$80,754 to $149,642 (UT, ID, MT, NM, SD, NE, KS, OK, IA, AR, LA, MS, AL, TN, KY, IN, SC, NC, WV)

The expected base salary for this position will vary depending on a number of factors, including relevant experience, skills and location.

Responsibilities

Essential Job Functions:

Multi-Rater Strategy & Leadership:

o Partner with technical product manager to develop and execute multi-rater strategies that align with business objectives, ensuring the platforms are fully optimized for both current and future needs.

Team Partnership:

o Partner with tech team (internal and/or external) of multi-rater developers, administrators, and consultants, fostering a collaborative environment and ensuring high productivity and quality standards.

o Partner with the tech team to provide guidance on sales needs for the future of multi-raters, helping to execute on the future vision of multi-raters for Mercury.

o Oversee the configuration and partner with tech team on configurations of various multi-raters to ensure optimal usage and deployment of multi-raters to increase relevancy in multi-rater platforms and drive PIF/premium growth

Stakeholder Collaboration:

o Work closely with business units (sales, enablement, engagement and underwriting) to understand and document business requirements, partner with tech team to deliver solutions

Project Management:

o Partner with tech team to manage the full project lifecycle of multi-rater break-fixes, enhancements and implementations, from planning and design through to execution, testing, deployment, and ongoing support.

Process Development and Management:

o Develop and manage business processes through stakeholder collaboration using standard process management tools.

Multi-Rater Best Practices:

o Partner with tech team to Implement and maintain best practices in multi-rater management and deployment, ensuring the platforms are continuously monitored, enhancements implemented, and break-fixes are addressed

Establishing KPIs and Reporting:

o Partner with tech team to ensure data integrity, error management, and reporting mechanisms to deliver accurate insights.

o Vetting data / analytics offerings from multi-raters and determining properly implementation partner internally

Knowledge Share:

o Provide insights to sales teams on how the Insurtech and multi-rater landscape is changing; arm sales teams with relevant info in this space to have more productive relationships with distributors

Qualifications

Education:

Minimum: Bachelor’s degree in Business, Analytics, Marketing, Insurance, Risk Management, or a related field.

Preferred: Experience managing multi-rater and/or APIs for P&C company in the past

Experience:

Minimum: 10+ years of experience with personal and/or commercial lines muti-raters

Skills & Abilities:

Minimum: Excellent leadership, communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills. Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities. Proficiency with multi-raters and Microsoft Office Suite.

About the Company

Why choose a career at Mercury?

At Mercury, we have been guided by our purpose to help people reduce risk and overcome unexpected events for more than 60 years. We are one team with a common goal to help others. Everyone needs insurance and we can’t imagine a world without it.

Our team will encourage you to grow, make time to have fun, and work together to make great things happen. We embrace the strengths and values of each team member. We believe in having diverse perspectives where everyone is included, to serve customers from all walks of life.

We care about our people, and we mean it. We reward our talented professionals with a competitive salary, bonus potential, and a variety of benefits to help our team members reach their health, retirement, and professional goals.

Learn more about us here: https://www.mercuryinsurance.com/about/careers

Perks and Benefits

We offer many great benefits, including:

  • Competitive compensation
  • Flexibility to work from anywhere in the United States for most positions
  • Paid time off (vacation time, sick time, 9 paid Company holidays, volunteer hours)
  • Incentive bonus programs (potential for holiday bonus, referral bonus, and performance-based bonus)
  • Medical, dental, vision, life, and pet insurance
  • 401 (k) retirement savings plan with company match
  • Engaging work environment
  • Promotional opportunities
  • Education assistance
  • Professional and personal development opportunities
  • Company recognition program
  • Health and wellbeing resources, including free mental wellbeing therapy/coaching sessions, child and eldercare resources, and more

Mercury Insurance is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.

Pay Range

USD $118,078.00 - USD $330,661.00 /Yr.

title: Manager, Software Development
description: At Iron Mountain we know that work, when done well, makes a positive impact for our customers, our employees, and our planet.

raw.title: Manager, Software Development
raw.excerpt: At Iron Mountain we know that work, when done well, makes a positive impact for our customers, our employees, and our planet.
raw.description:
At Iron Mountain we know that work, when done well, makes a positive impact for our customers, our employees, and our planet. That’s why we need smart, committed people to join us. Whether you’re looking to start your career or make a change, talk to us and see how you can elevate the power of your work at Iron Mountain.

We provide expert, sustainable solutions in records and information management, digital transformation services, data centers, asset lifecycle management, and fine art storage, handling, and logistics. We proudly partner every day with our 225,000 customers around the world to preserve their invaluable artifacts, extract more from their inventory, and protect their data privacy in innovative and socially responsible ways.

Are you curious about being part of our growth stor​y while evolving your skills in a culture that will welcome your unique contributions? If so, let's start the conversation.

Manager, Software Development


Job Summary:

At Iron Mountain, we protect what our customers value most, from the everyday to the extraordinary, while helping them bridge the physical and digital world. Today, we help our customers, including 95% of the Fortune 1000, to
preserve priceless art, restore classic films, outsource their data centers around the globe and more. Our people have the opportunity to bring their creativity to a workplace that thrives on change. Here you will be part of a team
that doesn't just embrace what's exceptional. It is exceptional. The Global Technology team at Iron Mountain deploys data center space to address growing customer needs and fast. Global Technology offers its customers a
set of data center solutions that afforded greater convenience and accessibility.The Manager Software Development role will be a part of the Global Product Engineering team at Iron Mountain.

The Manager Software Development position is in the Global Product Engineering organization assigned to the InSight project. Iron Mountain InSight is a content services platform that provides actionable business insights and
predictive analytics through Machine Learning (ML)-based classification of a company’s physical and digital information, which adds structure, context and meta-data to information to make it more usable. The resulting
enriched content can then enable enhanced automated governance and workflows for our customers.

The Manager Software Development will provide design and delivery of service functionality within the agile development lifecycle. The ideal candidate will be an experienced engineer with micro service development for
cloud-based services in highly performant systems. The candidate has over 7 years of experience developing service interfaces and APIs. To be successful, the candidate needs to show experience with Java and Python
core backend application development and SQL databases (SQL Server or Oracle or Postgresql or MySQL). The candidate must have experience exposing these backend systems over RESTful APIs, microservices, event
driven architecture and framework which interact with cloud service providers. The candidate should have extensive development experience with python, docker and linux shell scripting.

Why Iron Mountain?

Be a part of a company that’s driving digital transformation across all industry verticals, including finance, healthcare, and the public sector. We embrace a culture of experimentation and constantly strive for improvement and
learning. You'll work in a collaborative, trusting, and thought-provoking environment - one that encourages diversity of thought and creative solutions that are in the best interests of our customers globally.


Experience Required:

● 4+ years of overall experience

● Ensure successful delivery of initiatives using SAFe (scaled agile framework)
● Experience taking part in discussions with product management, IRM business operations, sales / pre-sales teams and direct customer-facing meetings.
● Experience with ECM, IDP, or document management systems is a plus
● knowledge of cloud infrastructure and services (GCP, AWS, and Azure)
● Knowledge of Microservices Architecture and Design

  • Familiarity with Low-code / No-code platform engineering

  • Familiarity with SaaS platform engineering

  • Familiarity with BPM Solutions

● The position requires strong interpersonal and communication skills, and the ability to collaborate with stakeholders in product management, IT, marketing, finance, and sales teams
● Experience and strong understanding of AI/ML models and Gen AI

● Experience with compliance frameworks such as FedRAMP, HIPAA, or ISO 27001 is a plus, with a focus on cloud-based service delivery, audit support, and security controls is a plus.


Essential Job Functions:

● Facilitate Agile ceremonies: Daily Standups, Sprint Planning, Backlog Grooming, Sprint Reviews, Retrospectives
● Ensure adherence to Scrum principles, Agile values, and team best practices
● Remove impediments and coordinate with cross-functional teams to resolve blockers
● Track sprint progress using velocity, burndown/burnup charts, and other Agile metrics
● Partner with the Product Owner to ensure well-defined user stories, acceptance criteria, and prioritization
● Foster a culture of continuous improvement and high-performance teamwork
● Participate/Lead design and solution discussions with various Iron Mountain partner vendors.
● Provide technical direction for the team across architecture, design, development, and deployment
● Break down user stories into technical tasks and guide developers on implementation approach
● Conduct code reviews and enforce coding standards, quality, and maintainability best practices
● Oversee solution design to ensure scalability, security, performance, and reliability
● Support CI/CD pipelines, automation, monitoring, and DevOps practices
● Help evaluate new technologies, tools, and frameworks for engineering effectiveness
● Drive end-to-end delivery ensuring predictable, high-quality releases
● Align with Product Owner, QA, DevOps, and other stakeholders to ensure smooth workflow
● Communicate risks, dependencies, delays, and technical challenges proactively
● Ensure documentation, technical design notes, and architectural decisions are maintained
● Mentor developers, encourage skill development, and support onboarding
● Promote knowledge-sharing, pair programming, and strong engineering culture
● Encourage team ownership of code quality, testing, and operational excellence


Functional Knowledge Skills & Competencies:

Skills:
● Technical background and understanding of enterprise solutions including networking, storage, hardware, and software layers.
● Understanding of Cloud Technologies and solutions (GCP or AWS or Azure)
● Understanding of Machine Learning and AI techniques, including usage of cognitive services and open source models.

● Working knowledge of Agile frameworks

● Understanding of Electronic Content Management Systems and Business Process Management Systems.
● Proficient in 5 or more of the following technologies/languages

  • Python

  • Java

  • SQL

  • BPMN

  • REST APIs

  • JSON/XML

  • Kubernetes

  • Computer Vision / NLP

● Strong research, analytical, and problem solving skills
● Strong verbal, interpersonal and written communication skills
● Ability to multitask and prioritize issues in a complex environment.
● Ability to participate and contribute in discussions related to ML/AI, ECM, BPM with various industry leading vendors.

Education:
● Minimum of Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or other related field required.

Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S. without the need for current or future visa sponsorship. Preference will be given to candidates with a current U.S. Government Security Clearance.

Category: Information Technology

raw.excerpt: ​​​​​​​ ​​​​​​​Senior Digital Marketing Account Manager – Franchising Location: Remote Company: FranDevCoAbout FranDevCoFranDevCo is a franchise growth organization supporting emerging and established brands across North America.
raw.description:
​​​​​​​ ​​​​​​​

Senior Digital Marketing Account Manager – Franchising
Location: Remote

Company: FranDevCo

About FranDevCo

FranDevCo is a franchise growth organization supporting emerging and established brands across North America. We specialize in building scalable franchise development systems that integrate high-performance sales, data-driven marketing, operations, and strategic finance. Our mission is to accelerate franchise expansion for our partners through proven processes, unmatched industry expertise, and a collaborative, purpose-driven culture.

With over 100 years of combined franchise experience, FranDevCo helps franchisors reach their growth goals by generating high-quality leads, attracting the right franchisees, and optimizing their development pipeline. We are committed to excellence and guided by our core values: G.R.O.W. – Growth, Reliable, Operate with Purpose, and a “We” Culture.

Position Overview

FranDevCo is seeking a Senior Digital Marketing Account Manager to lead strategic planning, execution, and client relationship management for our franchise development marketing programs. This role requires a highly skilled digital marketer who can think holistically, manage complex campaigns across multiple platforms, and serve as a trusted advisor to franchisor clients.

You will manage accounts directly, optimize lead-generation strategies, ensure strong campaign performance, and help shape long-term growth initiatives. As the department expands, this role may evolve into a leadership opportunity with direct mentorship and team development responsibilities.

Key Responsibilities

Client Strategy & Relationship Leadership

  • Serve as the primary point of contact for assigned clients, building trust-based, long-term partnerships.
  • Lead client discovery, onboarding, and strategy development aligned with franchise growth goals.
  • Deliver strategic recommendations based on industry best practices, performance insights, and client objectives.

Campaign Planning & Execution

  • Build and oversee digital lead generation strategies across Google Ads, Meta Ads, SEO, and additional paid channels.
  • Collaborate with internal teams to execute integrated, high-performing marketing campaigns.
  • Audit and optimize client websites, landing pages, and content to improve conversion rates and search visibility.

Performance Management & Reporting

  • Track, analyze, and interpret campaign data using platforms such as Google Analytics, WhatConverts, CRM systems, and ad manager tools.
  • Provide clear, actionable performance reporting, translating data into strategic insights and recommendations.
  • Identify gaps, troubleshoot performance issues, and implement optimizations to strengthen lead quality and ROI.

Team Mentorship & Development

  • Guide and support coordinators or junior team members, sharing strategic frameworks and advanced marketing techniques.
  • Provide coaching, feedback, and best practices to elevate team performance.
  • Promote a collaborative, innovative, and growth-oriented culture within the marketing team.

Cross-Functional Collaboration & Project Management

  • Work closely with creative, content, design, and operations teams to ensure seamless execution of marketing strategies.
  • Manage timelines, deliverables, and task coordination using platforms like Asana.
  • Act as an internal advocate for clients, ensuring their goals are understood and flawlessly executed across departments.

Key Qualifications

  • 5+ years of experience in digital marketing account management, with at least 3 years in multi-location or franchise marketing.
  • Demonstrated success managing SEO, PPC, paid social, and digital lead generation programs.
  • Proficiency with Google Analytics, Google Ads, Meta Ads Manager, and WordPress.
  • Strong analytical and strategic thinking skills, with the ability to turn data into actionable insights.
  • Ability to manage multiple clients and priorities in a fast-paced, high-growth environment.
  • Experience mentoring team members or leading small teams.
  • Familiarity with Asana or similar project management tools.
  • Exceptional communication, presentation, and client-facing relationship skills.

Compensation & Benefits

  • Competitive salary based on experience
  • Full-time, fully remote role (CST business hours)
  • Performance-based bonuses and potential commission opportunities
  • Opportunity to contribute to a rapidly growing franchise organization

If you are a strategic digital marketing leader who thrives in a fast-paced environment and is passionate about supporting franchise growth, we’d love to hear from you. Apply today and bring your expertise to a team that values innovation, collaboration, and excellence.

title: Voice recording (Indian Accent, India)
description: We are collecting audio accents for a multi-lingual AI platform.

raw.title: Voice recording (Indian Accent, India)
raw.excerpt: We are collecting audio accents for a multi-lingual AI platform.
raw.description:
We are collecting audio accents for a multi-lingual AI platform. We’re collecting ~3 hours of phone audio where speakers spell out names, emails, and phone numbers naturally — like talking to customer support. There will be different variations, environments you will need to work with (quietly, muffled voice, Phone on speaker-mode etc.)How it works:

  • You’ll call a demo line and record short sessions (caller side only).

  • Each call should sound natural — vary tone, pace, and include small pauses or filler words (“umm,” “let’s see,” etc.).

  • Must be real phone calls (no VoIP). Include some background noise for realism.

Requirements:

  • Must be based in USA, Canada or UK (the phone numbers you will call will be for these geos, we will not reimburse for international calling)

  • Must have a Indian accent from India

Deliverables:

  • Upto 30 phone calls in 6 variations (~180 calls)

  • The code provided by the agent during the call

  • Enter call data on a sheet shared with you (meta data, phone call code etc.)

    • Speaker ID or name

    • Gender

    • Age group

    • Primary language

    • Geographic ethnicity

What we need from you:

  • Your turnaround time will be 3 hours of conversation that needs to be filled before 12/28 (28th December)

raw.excerpt: Who We AreTetraScience is the Scientific Data and AI company.
raw.description:
Who We Are

TetraScience is the Scientific Data and AI company. We are catalyzing the Scientific AI revolution by designing and industrializing AI-native scientific data sets, which we bring to life in a growing suite of next gen lab data management solutions, scientific use cases, and AI-enabled outcomes.

TetraScience is the category leader in this vital new market, generating more revenue than all other companies in the aggregate. In the last year alone, the world’s dominant players in compute, cloud, data, and AI infrastructure have converged on TetraScience as the de facto standard, entering into co-innovation and go-to-market partnerships: Latest News and Announcements | TetraScience Newsroom:

In connection with your candidacy, you will be asked to carefully review the Tetra Way letter, authored directly by Patrick Grady, our co-founder and CEO. This letter is designed to assist you in better understanding whether TetraScience is the right fit for you from a values and ethos perspective.

It is impossible to overstate the importance of this document and you are encouraged to take it literally and reflect on whether you are aligned with our unique approach to company and team building. If you join us, you will be expected to embody its contents each day.

What You Will Do

  • Collaborate with product and engineering teams to drive and enhance the entire lifecycle of our products, from design and development to deployment and operation.
  • Work closely with clients to deploy and troubleshoot our products in clients' AWS environments ensuring smooth integration and optimal performance.
  • Develop CloudFormation templates, Terraform modules, Python scripts, deployment frameworks, monitors, and self-healing tools to automate processes and improve efficiency.
  • Assist the software engineering team in building accurate monitoring and metrics systems for applications before they go into production.
  • Manage the internal AWS environments and network, ensuring stability, security, and scalability while keeping costs in check
  • Participate in meetings with potential clients, working alongside solution architects to address their questions and concerns regarding integration of our products into their network and AWS accounts.
  • Maintain up-to-date documentation on deployments, processes, and standard operating procedures.

Requirements

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field; or equivalent practical experience.
  • At least 5 years of professional experience as a DevOps Engineer or in a similar role.
  • Extensive experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS), including AWS certification.
  • Proficiency in at least one programming language, such as Python (preferred), Java, or Go.
  • Strong proficiency in infrastructure-as-code (IaC) tools, preferably CloudFormation.
  • Good understanding and practical experience using and deploying AI (ML, LLMs)
  • Expertise in automating cloud-native technologies, deploying applications, and provisioning infrastructure.
  • Experience with cloud-native CI/CD workflows and tools, such as Github Actions or AWS CodeDeploy
  • Familiarity with microservices architecture, containerization, and orchestration tools like Docker and Kubernetes.
  • Solid understanding of Linux basics, networking fundamentals, and security best practices.
  • Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written.

Benefits

  • 100% employer-paid benefits for all eligible employees and immediate family members.
  • Unlimited paid time off (PTO).
  • 401K.
  • Flexible working arrangements - Remote work + office as needed.
  • Company paid Life Insurance, LTD/STD.
