title: Staff Accountant
description: Position Summary:The ideal candidate will play a crucial role in ensuring the accuracy and compliance of our financial operations.

raw.title: Staff Accountant
raw.excerpt: Position Summary:The ideal candidate will play a crucial role in ensuring the accuracy and compliance of our financial operations.
raw.description:
Position Summary:

The ideal candidate will play a crucial role in ensuring the accuracy and compliance of our financial operations. They will take ownership of key month-end close processes and must have thorough experience with US GAAP. Reporting directly to the Accounting Manager, they will lead all aspects of accounts receivable, from invoicing and cash application to collections and revenue reconciliation. They will work cross-functionally with the sales department to ensure accurate billing, timely payments, and resolution of discrepancies.

This role requires someone who thrives in the details, takes responsibility for the quality of their work, and approaches each task with urgency and follow through. They will dig into the source documents, validate the data, and question inconsistencies. They ask questions about their work and other's work until it makes sense. They start with understanding the work, knowing the why/purpose of each action and continue to ask the questions as they iterate.

Job Details:

Work from Home

Monday to Friday | 9 AM to 6 PM EST

*Following US Holidays

Responsibilities:

  • Financial Closing: Assist in the month-end and year-end closing processes, including the preparation and analysis of journal entries, to ensure timely and accurate financial reporting.
  • Accounts Receivable Ownership: Lead the end-to-end AR process, including invoicing, cash application, collections, and AR aging management, ensuring accuracy and timeliness across all.
  • AR Reconciliation: Perform monthly recon of accounts receivable by matching invoices amounts to cash collected. Identity and resolve unmatched transactions, unapplied payments, or discrepancies that impact the integrity of the AR ledger.
  • Process Improvement: Drive process improvements in the accounting department, enhancing efficiency, accuracy, and productivity.
  • Team Collaboration: Collaborate with other teams to ensure cohesive workflows.
  • Revenue Reconciliation: Reconcile deferred and unbilled revenues monthly, supporting and ensuring accurate revenue recognition.
  • Billing Accuracy: Review closed deals and coordinate with the Sales team to ensure valid and correct adherence to policy and proper billing.
  • Collection Strategy: Drive proactive collection efforts by managing outreach, tracking commitments and leading weekly collection meetings with Account Managers, Sales Representatives, and Accounting Manager.
  • Cash Application: Accurately apply customer payments, manage unmatched cash entries. Resolve overpayments.
  • Cross-Departmental Support: Serve as a key liaison to the Sales Department addressing billing inquiries and ensuring alignment of expectations across teams.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Accounting.
  • 2+ years of US company accounting experience.
  • Strong proficiency in US GAAP, with direct experience applying the standards to billing, revenue recognition, and month-end and year-end close procedures.
  • Excellent communication skills for resolving billing discrepancies and collaborating with other departments.
  • Advanced Excel/Google Sheets skills coupled with the ability to develop automated processes to extract raw data from ERP and convert to high quality information/reconciliations.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Strong ability to prioritize, multi-task and meet deadlines

raw.title: Call Center Sales Agent (Warm Leads)
raw.excerpt: Craving a fast-paced sales role where every conversation can lead to a win?
raw.description:
Craving a fast-paced sales role where every conversation can lead to a win? Step into a fully remote role where your voice drives results—and revenue. If you love connecting with people, crushing goals, and turning "maybe" into "yes," this one's for you.

About the Company:

This is a full-time role for a partner agency in the self-storage industry, specializing in technology-driven storage solutions. They focus on enhancing the rental experience through seamless digital tools and personalized customer service, helping individuals and businesses with secure and convenient storage options.


Location:Latin America & the Philippines - Fully Remote

Your Mission: Day to Day Responsibilities

  • Turn incoming calls and online leads into confirmed self-storage rentals

  • Guide customers through unit options and pricing, matching needs with solutions

  • Upsell when appropriate to boost revenue and occupancy

  • Handle move-out calls with empathy—aiming to retain customers through tailored rebuttals

  • Log customer interactions in the CRM with accuracy and timeliness

  • Hit key performance targets: conversions, follow-ups, and call volumes

  • Collaborate in team huddles and training sessions to stay sharp

  • Provide top-tier, on-brand customer service every time

Your Toolbox: Skills to be Successful

  • 1+ year in sales or a call center (bonus points if you’ve done both)

  • Confident, persuasive communicator with strong listening skills

  • Goal-driven with a competitive edge and drive to exceed quotas

  • Comfortable with CRM tools, call software, and everyday tech (Microsoft Office, etc.)

  • Quick on your feet—adaptable, coachable, and ready to problem-solve

  • Must be tech-savvy and able to quickly navigate multiple platforms throughout the day, including while handling live calls.

  • Must be available to work within US time zones.

  • An internet speed of at least 10 Mbps download and 5 Mbps upload is required.

Your Perks: What's in it for you

  • Working completely remote

  • Location independence

  • 15 Paid leave days

  • Quarterly bonus

  • Weekend bonus

  • Yearly salary increase policy (7% after 6 months, then 5% after additional 6 months)

  • Long-term position with the opportunity to grow in a stable and growing Agency

  • Great opportunity to grow

  • You’ll be joining a high-level and fast-paced team

Why Adaptive Teams?
At Adaptive Teams, we don’t just fill positions – we create pathways to success. Whether you’re a seasoned pro or just starting out, we’re here to help you grow, innovate, and make an impact. If you’re looking for exciting opportunities and, a team that’s as passionate as you are, this is the place to be.

What to Expect from Our Application Process?
Once you apply, you’ll receive an email guiding you through the next steps, including an assessment tailored to the role. Be sure to check your inbox (and your spam folder, just in case) for further instructions.

We understand your time is valuable, so we strive to keep the assessment process under 45 minutes whenever possible, though some roles may require a slightly longer time investment.

Once selected, you’ll have the chance to schedule your first interview with our team. We aim to make the process as smooth and transparent as possible, so you’ll always know where you stand.

title: CRM and FSM Implementation Specialist

raw.title: CRM and FSM Implementation Specialist
raw.excerpt: Location: Remote (India) Work Schedule: Full-Time, India Standard Time (9:30 PM to 6:30 AM IST, Monday to Friday) Must have prior experience working with U.
raw.description:
Location: Remote (India)
Work Schedule: Full-Time, India Standard Time (9:30 PM to 6:30 AM IST, Monday to Friday)

Must have prior experience working with U.S. clients

About CoreBridge Solutions

CoreBridge Solutions is a trusted outsourcing and digital innovation partner for United States-based firms. We help organizations improve operations through modern platforms, streamlined workflows, and strong execution. We support industries such as legal, real estate, finance, marketing, and field service to create efficient systems that drive measurable results.

Our approach is grounded in technology, operational excellence, and continuous improvement. We build systems and processes that help clients scale and operate more effectively.

Position Overview

We are looking for a System Implementation Manager who can take real operational needs and translate them into well-built, reliable system workflows. You will primarily support the implementation, configuration, and integration of our field service and customer relationship platforms.

You will work closely with operations, leadership, and field teams to turn business requirements into practical system setups, clean data structures, and clear workflows.

You will work with:

  • Zuper for FSM scheduling, dispatch, work orders, inventory, and asset tracking
  • HubSpot for CRM, sales, service, and customer lifecycle management

You will focus on implementing configurations, building automations, improving processes, and helping users adopt these tools smoothly.

Success in this role means keeping data accurate, improving workflow efficiency, and ensuring teams can rely on Zuper and HubSpot to support daily operations.

Key Responsibilities

System Implementation and Configuration

  • Configure Zuper and HubSpot based on business requirements, including fields, workflows, automations, and dashboards.
  • Support testing, UAT, and go-live activities for new processes or integrations.

Integrations and Data Flow

  • Support integrations between Zuper, HubSpot, and other platforms to keep data consistent and accurate.
  • Document integration logic and field mappings for clear future maintainability.

Process Documentation and Workflow Improvement

  • Assist in mapping and improving operational workflows such as scheduling, call-to-cash, preventative maintenance, and service delivery.
  • Ensure processes are clearly documented with diagrams, checklists, and written procedures.

Data Migration and Data Quality

  • Support data migration efforts including extraction, cleansing, mapping, and validation of customer, asset, and service data.

Training and User Support

  • Deliver training to office staff and field teams on how to use the systems effectively.
  • Create simple playbooks and guides to help users adopt new features.

Collaboration and Continuous Improvement

  • Work closely with leadership and operational teams to understand requirements and help prioritize system enhancements.
  • Monitor system performance and recommend improvements.

Your Profile

Required Skills and Experience

  • Three or more years experience implementing or supporting FSM, ERP, or CRM systems such as Zuper, ServiceMax, Salesforce, Acumatica, or similar.
  • Hands-on experience configuring HubSpot CRM, including workflows, automation, and custom properties or objects.
  • Experience working with ERP systems (Acumatica experience preferred but not required).
  • Understanding of API integrations and how data flows across multiple systems.
  • Ability to map and document business processes with clarity.
  • Strong project coordination, problem-solving, and communication skills.

Nice-to-Have Skills

  • Experience implementing Zuper or another FSM platform.
  • Background in field service work such as HVAC, commercial refrigeration, or appliance repair.
  • Experience training field or non-technical users.

Why Join CoreBridge Solutions

At CoreBridge, you’ll be part of a company that values innovation and efficiency, with a track record of transforming industry standards in a collaborative, fast-paced environment. Our team consists of passionate individuals who strive to provide solutions that not only meet but exceed our customers' expectations. Join us and contribute to our mission to redefine the property management landscape, one project at a time.

Benefits

  • Opportunity to work remotely from anywhere in India.
  • Performance-related bonuses celebrating significant milestones.
  • A genuine commitment to maintaining a healthy work-life balance with a 40-hour workweek.

Work Environment Notice

CoreBridge Solutions is dedicated to maintaining a productive, safe, and efficient work environment for all team members. To support this commitment, we use a live monitoring system during working hours. By applying for this position, you acknowledge and accept this monitoring process as part of your role. This system helps us ensure a supportive and effective work environment for everyone.

How to Apply

Ready to make an impact? Please fill out the application form and upload your CV in PDF format. We look forward to learning more about you and how you can contribute to our team.

raw.description:
iGaming Localisation & Documentation Coordinator

Own the documentation, accuracy, and localisation workflow for iGaming slot titles.

Remote (South Africa) | iGaming | R45,000 – R70,000 per month | UK Hours

About Our Client

Our client is a remote-first games company focused on the development of high-quality, regulated iGaming slot content. They offer a structured, process-driven environment with a strong emphasis on accuracy, compliance, and team collaboration across global markets.

The Role: iGaming Localisation & Documentation Coordinator

This role is responsible for maintaining all localisation assets and written documentation for slot games, including GDDs, help files, and in-game text. Youll coordinate localisation with external partners, ensure documentation is up to date across multiple languages and game versions, and work closely with internal teams to align text and documentation with implemented features.

Key Responsibilities

  • Minimum 3 years of experience in technical writing, documentation, or localisation coordination
  • Maintain and update game design documents and supporting documentation
  • Manage all provided English in-game text and prepare it for localisation
  • Create and maintain HTML-based game help files
  • Track and implement text updates throughout development and post-launch
  • Coordinate with external translators to manage localisation processes
  • Review translated content for completeness, formatting, and technical accuracy
  • Collaborate with game designers, producers, QA, and developers to ensure alignment

About You

  • Proven experience as a Technical Writer, Documentation Specialist, or similar role
  • Excellent written English with a focus on clarity, structure, and precision
  • Familiarity with HTML and web-based formatting
  • Experience working with localisation workflows and managing translation partners
  • Highly organised with strong attention to detail
  • Comfortable managing multiple projects and frequent text iterations
  • iGaming experience is essential (slots, casino, or regulated games)
  • Desirable: Experience with game development pipelines, string file management, or version control systems (e.g., Git, Perforce)
  • Only candidates with iGaming experience will be considered. Remote applicants are welcome, preferably based in South Africa. UK working hours apply.

Chcesz zarabiać w sprzedaży i obsłudze klienta.

📍Szukasz zajęcia, które pogodzisz z innymi aktywnościami.

📍Chcesz pomagać klientom w realizacji ich planów.

rola Doradcy/ Doradczyni Klienta jest właśnie dla Ciebie!

Mamy dla Ciebie :

🔷 Wynagrodzenie zależne od Twoich osiągnięć, z prowizją, premiami oraz bonusem zespołowym za realizację celów.

🔷Programy wspierające Twoje zarobki w okresie wdrożenia.

🔷Najlepsze narzędzia: Tablet, telefon z bezpłatnym abonamentem oraz aplikacje ze wspierającą Cię zawsze aktualną wiedzą.

🔷Elastyczne godziny współpracy: Elastyczne godziny współpracy: Możliwość dostosowania harmonogramu do Twoich potrzeb.

🔷Sponsorowane Ubezpieczenie NNW: Zapewniamy dodatkowe zabezpieczenie.

🔷Umowę cywilnoprawną: Z naszym wkładem w Twoją przyszłą emeryturę poprzez odprowadzanie składek do ZUS.

Dodatkowo gwarantujemy:

🔷 Grupę klientów na start: Od razu po rozpoczęciu współpracy.

🔷 Kompleksowe wdrożenie pod opieką mentora.

🔷 Szkolenia wdrożeniowe i rozwojowe:m.in. ze sprzedaży, komunikacji i kompetencji miękkich.

🔷 Bezpłatną Certyfikację OFWCA przy KNF:Umożliwi Ci to także sprzedaż ubezpieczeń indywidualnych.

➡️ Z nami zyskujesz przejrzystą ŚCIEŻKĘ ROZWOJU,w tym możliwości awansu na rolę Doradcy Klienta Eksperta, a także na stanowisko Kierownika Rejonu.

Zadania, które chcemy Ci powierzyć:

  • Sprzedaż produktów (m.in. pożyczki, karty kredytowe, ubezpieczenia).
  • Obsługa posprzedażowa i odbiór rat u klientów.
  • Budowanie i utrzymywanie relacji z klientami.
  • Pozyskiwanie klientów.

Zainteresowała Cię ta propozycja?

Wystarczy, że masz:

  • Wykształcenie minimum średnie.
  • Otwartość na współpracę z klientami w terenie.
  • Gotowość do nabywania nowej wiedzy i umiejętności.
  • Łatwość w nawiązywaniu kontaktów, a współpraca z ludźmi sprawia Ci przyjemność.

Osoby zainteresowane ofertą prosimy o wypełnienie formularza zgłoszeniowego. 👇

raw.description:
Business Coach/Consultant | Leadership & Strategy

Sick ofworkwhere you feel invisible, underutilised, or stuck doing work that doesn’t matter?

Where growth is slow, your ideas get ignored, and you’re surrounded by driftwood instead of real talent? Where “development opportunities” are a joke and the culture sucks the energy out of you?

It doesn’t have to be like that.

At Profitable Tradie:

  • Your voice matters - disagree, challenge, speak up. We actually listen
  • Stagnation doesn’t exist here- we push you to grow harder, faster, and smarter every day
  • You’ll work with legends - no driftwood, just top-tier talent who push you to be better every day
  • Impact is real - the work you do changes lives, both for clients and the team around you
  • Fun isn’t optional - our banter is off the charts and we work hard while laughing harder

If you’re done settling for mediocre and want to step into a role that actually excites, challenges, and rewards you, this is where you belong.

Who We Are

Profitable Tradie is a fast-growing business coaching company with an international reputation for transforming trade businesses. We help plumbing, electrical, and service-based business owners across New Zealand, Australia, and North America build profitable, scalable businesses- and regain control of their time, money, and lifestyle.

Our mission?
Turn great tradespeople into great business owners.

We do this through cutting-edge coaching, sales and marketing strategies, streamlined systems, and leadership development.

We’re growing fast and need another A+ coach to help our clients scale their businesses and change their lives.

What You’ll Be Doing

As a business coach, your role is to ensure our clients experience world-class coaching that drives real business results.

You'll be both a "doer" and a "designer" in this role:

The Doing – Delivering world-class coaching sessions

  • One-on-one and group coaching with business owners
  • Facilitating online training sessions
  • Monitoring client results and engagement
  • Answering questions on our coaching portals and Facebook groups

The Designing – Improving our coaching systems

  • Identifying and implementing better ways to help clients grow
  • Developing coaching resources to drive client success
  • Optimizing coaching processes to get faster results

Your ultimate goal? Help clients grow profits, improve their lifestyle, and become better business leaders.

Who You Are

We’re looking for someone with the right attitude, skills, and business mindset - someone who thrives in a leadership role and knows how to get results.

To thrive in this role, you should:

  • Be a natural leader and communicator who can inspire and hold people accountable
  • Have a solid understanding of business fundamentals - profit margins, cash flow, team management, and marketing strategies
  • Be results-driven, focused on outcomes, and able to push clients to achieve success
  • Have experience coaching, consulting, or running a business
  • Be a lifelong learner- always reading, listening to podcasts, or seeking new ways to grow
  • Bring energy, fun, and accountability to everything you do

Why Join Us?

At Profitable Tradie, we don’t just talk about growth- we live it.

  • World-class learning & development - Access to top-tier business training, speakers, books, and personal growth strategies
  • High-performance culture - A team of A-players who love to win, execute, and make an impact
  • Results-driven & supportive - Weekly coaching and performance reviews to help you become the best version of yourself
  • Fun, energy & banter - Laughter is compulsory- long faces are banned

We’re interviewing top candidates immediately- don’t wait!

Life is about moments… is this your moment?

title: Sales Manager - Benelux & UK
description: Arxada is a global leader in innovative solutions that protect our world.

raw.title: Sales Manager - Benelux & UK
raw.excerpt: Arxada is a global leader in innovative solutions that protect our world.
raw.description:
Arxada is a global leader in innovative solutions that protect our world. Our groundbreaking technologies, in-depth regulatory know-how, manufacturing and process development help our customers to safeguard nutrition, health and infrastructure efficiently through chemistry and biotechnology that enhance sustainability. We offer a broad portfolio of ingredients and services for multiple end-markets that include Human Health & Nutrition, Home & Personal Care, Professional Hygiene, Paints & Coatings and Wood Protection.

With customers in more than 100 countries, the company achieved sales of CHF 2 billion in 2024. Headquartered in Basel (Switzerland), Arxada employs 3,200 associates across 24 production sites and 14 R&D centers, all committed to our customers’ success.

As part of our bold growth strategy in the Benelux and UK markets, we are seeking a dynamic and results-driven Sales Manager to join Arxada’s Paints & Coatings business line. In this role, you will be instrumental in driving revenue growth, expanding market presence, and building strong, long-term partnerships with customers. You will identify new opportunities, develop strategic relationships, and lead the full sales cycle: from prospecting to closing deals and signing contracts.

Location: Flexible remote within Benelux or UK
Business Line: Paints & Coatings, Business Unit of MCS

Essential Job Functions

  • Deliver on agreed financial and commercial objectives for the assigned territory and market segment
  • Actively contribute to the development and execution of strategic sales and marketing plans that increase gross profit and expand market share
  • Identify and pursue new business opportunities, ensuring timely and successful delivery
  • Forecast and plan demand accurately
  • Build and maintain a robust pipeline of opportunities using CRM tools such as Salesforce or Microsoft Dynamics
  • Continuously improve profitability through price management and optimise cash flow, handling payment terms and overdues
  • Gather and analyse market intelligence, trends, and competitive insights to inform strategy
  • Provide exceptional customer care and champion a customer-first mindset across the organisation
  • Run distributor channels effectively within the region
  • Ensure seamless coordination between customers and Arxada’s Supply Chain and Customer Service teams for accurate planning and delivery
  • Promote Arxada’s core values and lead by example in EHS compliance, fostering a culture of safety and responsibility

Qualifications & Experience

  • Bachelor’s degree in Chemistry, Engineering, Business or a related field (or equivalent experience)
  • Business fluency in English; Dutch language skills would be beneficial
  • Min. 5+ years of proven experience in technical sales and/or new business development
  • Experience working within complex, matrix, multinational organisations
  • Strong track record in selling technically driven products and solutions
  • Excellent interpersonal and organisational skills, with the ability to communicate complex concepts clearly in both verbal and written form
  • Self-motivated, entrepreneurial attitude with a passion for growth and innovation
  • Willing and able to travel internationally (up to 50%)

Arxada has world class offering intwo distinct areas:

Microbial Control Solutions (MCS) focuses on threats posed by microorganisms to people and planet through five distinct business lines including Professional Hygiene, Home & Personal Care, Wood Protection, Paints & Coatings and Material Protection.

Nutrition, Care & Environmental (NCE), meanwhile, provides materials used to manufacture composites for electronics, aerospace and other markets, as well as vitamins and nutritional ingredients, chemicals and performance intermediates, and raw materials for a wide range of high-performance applications.

Arxada is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a qualified individual with disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Graphic Designer
description: Modo Labs is seeking an experienced Graphic Designer!

raw.title: Graphic Designer
raw.excerpt: Modo Labs is seeking an experienced Graphic Designer!
raw.description:
Modo Labs is seeking an experienced Graphic Designer!

JOIN US AT MODO

Are you ready to build a rewarding career and redefine the digital experience?

Join us in our mission to help organizations simplify anytime access to the information, tools, and resources their users need to feel supported, engaged, and inspired. The Modo digital engagement platform has empowered the world’s most recognized academic institutions and global brands to create branded, fully-customized “super apps” for their organizations. As a category leader for workplace and campus apps, our SaaS solution accelerates development, streamlines content creation, and offers virtually unlimited possibilities to integrate popular tools, essential systems, and engaging features into a unified app.

THE OPPORTUNITY

This role is ideal for a mid-level designer with 3–5 years of experience who is eager to take ownership, bring fresh perspective, and help evolve and modernize an established brand in a competitive market.

Modo has an established brand foundation that has not been significantly refreshed in several years. This designer will work within existing brand guidelines while thoughtfully evolving the look and feel to be more modern, fresh, and relevant to the enterprise workplace and higher education markets we serve.

This is a highly collaborative, individual contributor role. The position focuses primarily on marketing design (approximately 80%), while also contributing to customer-facing design (approximately 20%).

Thisis a remote position that can be performed from anywhere in the continental U.S.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Design and produce high-quality marketing assets across digital and print channels, including:
  • Website graphics and landing pages
  • Campaign visuals for email, social, paid media, and events
  • Sales enablement materials such as presentations, one-pagers, case studies, blog posts, and ebooks
  • Partner closely with Marketing to evolve and modernize Modo’s visual identity while maintaining brand consistency
  • Provide design support for customers and demo/showcase apps using Modo's software platform
  • Collaborate cross-functionally with marketing, design, sales, and content stakeholders to translate concepts into effective visual solutions.
  • Manage multiple projects simultaneously, prioritizing deadlines and business impact
  • Incorporate feedback efficiently while maintaining strong design judgment
  • Prepare, distribute, save, and organize final assets for media
  • Leverage AI-assisted design and creative tools to accelerate concepting, iteration, and production.
  • Continuously explore and recommend new tools, workflows, and technologies (including AI) to improve efficiency, creativity, and speed to market

OUR WISH LIST

  • Bachelor’s degree in Graphic Design, Visual Communication, or a related field. Equivalent training or experience may be substituted.
  • 3-5 years of professional graphic design experience required
  • Experience in B2B, SaaS marketing environments preferred
  • Experience in supporting both marketing and product design is a plus
  • Strong visual design skills with a modern, digital/mobile-first sensibility
  • Proficiency with industry-standard design tools (Adobe Creative Suite, Canva, Figma)
  • Solid understanding of branding, typography, layout, and visual hierarchy
  • Experience designing for websites, campaigns, and marketing funnels
  • Ability to work independently, while being open to mentorship and collaboration
  • Strong communication, organization, and time-management skills
  • Comfort operating in a fast-paced, competitive B2B environment
  • Experience using AI-powered design, image generation, or creative automation tools to enhance workflows and explore new creative approaches to getting work done.
  • Curiosity and proficiency to learn new tools

WHAT WE OFFER

  • Attractive compensation package including equity: The base hiring range for this position is $75,000 - $85,000. This range is considered a national average determined by the knowledge, skills, and abilities required for this role. Starting compensation will be commensurate with an individual’s background, experience, and location and may vary.
  • Comprehensive medical, dental, vision, life, & disability insurance coverage offered for you and your loved ones.
  • 401k Retirement Plan: 50% match on the first 6% of total compensation
  • Remote Team: We promote flexible working wherever we can, so whether you prefer to be fully remote or in an office, the choice is yours.
  • Generous Time Off: Take the time you need, when you need it, plus 12 company holidays.
  • Parental Leave: 12 weeks of paid leave following a child’s birth, adoption, or foster care placement following one year of service.
  • Quarterly Stipend: $500 per quarter stipend to cover Internet, mobile phone, office parking, office transportation, office equipment, technology hardware (excluding laptop), etc.

Modo Labs provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, gender identity, national origin, disability, genetics, veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. In addition to federal law requirements, Modo Labs complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

Modo Labs will not discriminate or retaliate against applicants for failing to disclose wage rate history in accordance with applicable law.

Modo Labs expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status. Improper interference with the ability of Modo Labs employees to perform their job duties may result in discipline up to and including discharge.

Salary: $75k - $85k

title: Applied AI Engineer - Remote, UK Company
description: Anypear is a headhunting and recruitment agency connecting New Zealand and Australian businesses with top overseas talent.

raw.title: Applied AI Engineer - Remote, UK Company
raw.excerpt: Anypear is a headhunting and recruitment agency connecting New Zealand and Australian businesses with top overseas talent.
raw.description:
Anypear is a headhunting and recruitment agency connecting New Zealand and Australian businesses with top overseas talent.

We are looking for an insightful and innovative Applied AI Engineer to help our client, a UK based YouTube Media Company, put data and technology at the heart of decision making. Reporting directly to the Director of Data and Technology, you’ll be responsible for building agentic workflows and data pipelines to optimise YouTube creators’ performance and growth.

Responsibilities

  • Proactively research, plan and deploy agentic AI workflow initiatives that deliver high business impact and conduct regular maintenance, monitoring and updates.
  • Partner with non-technical team members to identify bottlenecks and translate them into technical specifications for AI agents.
  • Define and track success metrics (ROI, time saved, viewer growth) for deployed workflows to demonstrate value to the leadership team.
  • Explain and demonstrate the business impact of AI agent implementation to help the team migrate and navigate new AI adoptions.
  • Design, test and ship production-grade agentic workflows in Python (ideally using LangGraph).
  • When required, contribute to the development, testing and maintenance of fast, reliable data pipelines.
  • AI/ML
    • Knowledge of applying LLMs and developing, testing and deploying agentic systems in Python (ideally LangGraph)
    • Deep knowledge of Python and relevant libraries (LangChain, LangGraph, FastAPI, Pydantic, etc)
  • Data Engineering
    • Knowledge of designing, building, testing, deploying and maintaining data pipelines using Airflow (and ideally Cloud Composer)
  • DevOps
    • Good understanding of DevOps processes (Docker, CI/CD in GitHub actions, deploying in GCP)
    • Good understanding of GCP (especially Cloud Composer, Cloud Run, Google App Engine)
    • Deep knowledge of version control (GitHub)

What your first 6 months may look like:

  • Launch an internal agentic tool, aimed at improving efficiency and quality.
  • Improve the speed and reliability of our data pipelines.

Requirements

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics or STEM subject.
  • Experience - Minimum of 3 years in an AI/ML/Data Engineer position.
  • English fluency
  • Communication skills (especially technical points to non-technical audience)
  • Ability to quickly & effectively prototype
  • Keen interest in applying AI to business problems

Nice to have

  • Developing/deploying/testing APIs & RAG systems.
  • Experience in the digital content or media sector (ideally YouTube).
  • Experience mentoring junior team members.

Benefits

  • Remote Role, flexible hours, overlap with UK timezone required.
  • Opportunity to join an exciting, well-funded and fast-growing creator economy business.
  • World-class creative culture
  • Competitive salary

title: National General Adjuster
description: By joining Sedgwick, you'll be part of something truly meaningful.

raw.title: National General Adjuster
raw.excerpt: By joining Sedgwick, you'll be part of something truly meaningful.
raw.description:
By joining Sedgwick, you'll be part of something truly meaningful. It’s what our 33,000 colleagues do every day for people around the world who are facing the unexpected. We invite you to grow your career with us, experience our caring culture, and enjoy work-life balance. Here, there’s no limit to what you can achieve.

Newsweek Recognizes Sedgwick as America’s Greatest Workplaces National Top Companies

Certified as a Great Place to Work®

Fortune Best Workplaces in Financial Services & Insurance

National General Adjuster

PRIMARY PURPOSE: To handle losses or claims nationally regardless of size, including having the ability to address any complex adjustment issue and any medium sized and relatively complex National Account.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS and RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Examines insurance policies, claims, and other records to determine insurance coverage.
  • Administers and reconciles complex catastrophic claims for property.
  • Interviews, telephones, or corresponds with claimant(s) and witnesses regarding claim.
  • Consults police and hospital records; and inspects property damage to determine extent of company's liability and varying methods of investigation according to type of insurance.
  • Estimates cost of repair, replacement, or compensation.
  • Prepares report of findings and negotiates settlement with claimant.
  • Recommends litigation by legal department when settlement cannot be negotiated.
  • Attends litigation hearings.
  • Revises case reserves in assigned claims files to cover probably costs.
  • Prepares loss experience reports to help determine profitability and calculates adequate future rates.
  • Interacts with excess carrier to determine coverages, excess insurance levels, and potential reimbursements.

ADDITIONAL FUNCTIONS and RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Performs other duties as assigned.
  • Travels as required.

QUALIFICATIONS

Education & Licensing

Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university preferred. Must have earned the IIA-AIC designation and be actively pursuing another professional insurance designation.

Experience
Five (5) years of related experience or equivalent combination of education and experience required.

Skills & Knowledge

  • Strong oral and written communication, including presentation skills
  • PC literate, including Microsoft Office products
  • Strong customer service skills
  • Attention to detail and accuracy
  • Good time management and organizational skills
  • Ability to work independently or in a team environment
  • Ability to meet or exceed Performance Competencies

WORK ENVIRONMENT

When applicable and appropriate, consideration will be given to reasonable accommodations.

Mental: Clear and conceptual thinking ability; excellent judgment and discretion; ability to handle work-related stress; ability to handle multiple priorities simultaneously; and ability to meet deadlines

Physical:

  • Ability to stand and/or walk for long periods of time.
  • Ability to kneel, squat or bend.
  • Ability to work outdoors in hot and/or cold weather conditions.
  • Ability to climb, crawl, stoop, kneel, reaching/working overhead.
  • Ability to lift/carry up to 50 pounds.
  • Ability to push/pull up to 100 pounds.
  • Ability to drive up to 4 hours per day.
  • Must have continual use of manual dexterity.

Auditory/Visual: Hearing, vision and talking.

The statements contained in this document are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by a colleague assigned to this description. They are not intended to constitute a comprehensive list of functions, duties, or local variances. Management retains the discretion to add or to change the duties of the position at any time.

As required by law, Sedgwick provides a reasonable range of compensation for roles that may be hired in jurisdictions requiring pay transparency in job postings. Actual compensation is influenced by a wide range of factors including but not limited to skill set, level of experience, and cost of specific location. For the jurisdiction noted in this job posting only, the range of starting pay for this role is $90-130k. A comprehensive benefits package is offered including but not limited to, medical, dental, vision, 401k and matching, PTO, disability and life insurance, employee assistance, flexible spending or health savings account, and other additional voluntary benefits.We are always accepting applications.

Sedgwick is an Equal Opportunity Employer and a Drug-Free Workplace.

If you're excited about this role but your experience doesn't align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, consider applying for it anyway! Sedgwick is building a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace and recognizes that each person possesses a unique combination of skills, knowledge, and experience. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

title: Senior National Account Manager - USA
description: At Joseph Joseph, we are driven by a simple yet powerful belief — that intelligent design has the ability to transform everyday living.

raw.title: Senior National Account Manager - USA
raw.excerpt: At Joseph Joseph, we are driven by a simple yet powerful belief — that intelligent design has the ability to transform everyday living.
raw.description:
At Joseph Joseph, we are driven by a simple yet powerful belief — that intelligent design has the ability to transform everyday living. We create distinctive, thoughtfully engineered products that not only solve real-world problems but also bring joy, beauty, and functionality to daily life.

Headquartered in London, we have grown into one of the world’s most admired houseware brands, with a presence in over 100 countries and partnerships with leading department stores, independent retailers, and a rapidly expanding e-commerce business.

We are expanding our U.S. sales team and are seeking a Senior National Account Manager to manage key grocery and drug channel customers. Reporting to the Director of Sales (USA), this role is responsible for driving profitable growth across assigned national and regional grocery accounts through strategic planning, strong customer partnerships, and cross-functional collaboration.

What you will be doing:

• Achieve or exceed all sales and profitability KPIs across assigned customers and channel portfolio

• Identify and develop new customer opportunities using a strategic and entrepreneurial approach

• Drive growth within existing accounts by building strong partnerships and executing both short- and long-term business strategies

  • Lead new product introductions and category expansion initiatives that support revenue growth and brand development

• Develop, implement, and regularly review comprehensive account plans, including promotional strategies and financial performance

• Monitor and analyze competitive activity, market dynamics, and evolving customer and consumer trends

• Collaborate closely with internal cross-functional teams to deliver best-in-class customer service while meeting corporate financial and strategic objectives

• Manage all required administrative responsibilities, including business plans, reports, presentations, pricing controls, and performance evaluations

• Contribute to the broader success of the organization by working collaboratively and adapting to changing priorities

What we need from you:

• Proven experience managing and growing sales within a consumer products organization at a National or Key Account Manager level

• Minimum of 5 years of experience managing accounts within the grocery channel – Strong preference in experience with Whole Foods, Kroger, Albertsons, or Publix

• Strong working knowledge of broker and distributor management within the channel

• Proven track record of achieving business development, revenue growth, and margin improvement across a portfolio of products

• Experience developing and executing customer account plans and trade marketing strategies while effectively managing budgets

• Ability to work cross-functionally with internal teams, including Sales Operations, S&OP, Marketing, and Customer Service

• Excellent communication, negotiation, and relationship-building skills, with the ability to influence at all levels

• Demonstrate excellent analytical, planning, problem solving, presentation and organizational skills

• Self-motivated, results-oriented, and able to work effectively both independently and as part of a team

• Ability to travel within the US and attend trade shows as needed

• Bachelor’s degree in business or a related discipline preferred

What you will get from us:

• Competitive salary and bonus program

• Health Benefits

• 401k with company match

• Flexible Hybrid working - both in-office & remote

title: Email Designer
description: ARE YOU OUR NEXT EMAIL DESIGNER? Our client, YOCTO (yocto.

raw.title: Email Designer
raw.excerpt: ARE YOU OUR NEXT EMAIL DESIGNER? Our client, YOCTO (yocto.
raw.description:
ARE YOU OUR NEXT EMAIL DESIGNER?
Our client, YOCTO (yocto.agency), is seeking a highly skilled and results-oriented Email Designer to join their team for a full-time remote position. As they continue to expand, we are looking for a talented individual who can bring their expertise in DTC email design and marketing to drive conversion and click-through rates.
Your core role and responsibilities:
  • Design captivating and visually appealing emails using Figma, ensuring they align with brand guidelines and effectively communicate key messages.
  • ClickUp Task Management for reviewing daily briefs and managing tasks efficiently.
  • Continuously research and stay updated on email design, branding, and user experience (UX) trends in the e-commerce space to enhance existing email templates.
  • Take charge of the visual and creative direction for YOCTO as an agency, maintaining consistent branding across all communications.
  • Occasionally handle ad hoc design tasks for the agency, such as creating PowerPoint presentations.
  • Collaborate with clients to develop Figma Boards based on their Brand Book, utilizing it as a constructor to rapidly iterate new versions of on-brand emails.
Qualifications and Requirements:
  • Demonstrated experience in direct-to-consumer eCommerce (DTC) email design
  • Proficiency in designing cart abandonment emails and understanding email marketing flows
  • A portfolio showcasing previous DTC email design work
  • Proficient in Figma Design
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English
  • Strong understanding of marketing principles and the ability to use design strategically to increase conversions and click-through rates
Is it us you're looking for?

At YOCTO, we provide email marketing management services for e-commerce brands that use Shopify or WooCommerce. Our tool of choice is Klaviyo. Our mission is to become the #1 email marketing agency for e-commerce brands in the world.

YOCTO is not everyone, but if you're the best at what you do and you have fun outside of work, we'd love for you to join our team and become part of our mission to achieve big things globally!

- Unlimited personal/professional growth

﻿- Remote working environment

﻿- Good, fun team culture with a flat hierarchy
﻿- Hardworking, talented, respectful Team

title: Middle–Senior Legal Counsel (FinTech)
description: Про компаніюНаш клієнт - AI-driven фінтех-компанія, що працює на глобальних ринках (Європа, Великобританія, Мальта, Африка, LATAM) та спеціалізується на платіжних рішеннях, PSP/EMI-інтеграціях і сучасних фінансових продуктах.

raw.title: Middle–Senior Legal Counsel (FinTech)
raw.excerpt: Про компаніюНаш клієнт - AI-driven фінтех-компанія, що працює на глобальних ринках (Європа, Великобританія, Мальта, Африка, LATAM) та спеціалізується на платіжних рішеннях, PSP/EMI-інтеграціях і сучасних фінансових продуктах.
raw.description:
Про компанію

Наш клієнт - AI-driven фінтех-компанія, що працює на глобальних ринках (Європа, Великобританія, Мальта, Африка, LATAM) та спеціалізується на платіжних рішеннях, PSP/EMI-інтеграціях і сучасних фінансових продуктах.

Компанія активно масштабується й працює у high-risk fintech середовищі, яке включає роботу з міжнародними платежами, PSP/EMI-провайдерами, регуляторними вимогами різних юрисдикцій та підвищеними вимогами до комплаєнсу.

У команду потрібен Middle–Senior Legal Counsel, який посилить юридичну функцію та візьме на себе ключові міжнародні процеси.

Ключова місія ролі

Забезпечувати юридичний супровід міжнародної платіжної інфраструктури компанії: договори, корпоративні процеси, PSP/банківські онбординги, участь у регуляторних та ліцензійних проєктах, взаємодія з зовнішніми радниками та внутрішніми командами.

Роль сфокусована на операційній роботі у high-risk фінансовому середовищі та участі у міжнародних стратегічних ініціативах. Пряма взаємодія з Head of Legal.

Основні обов’язки

1. Договори та контрактна робота

  • Підготовка, аналіз і погодження:

    • partnership / referral agreements

    • PSP agreements

    • SaaS / licensing / payment agreements

    • NDA, MSA, DPA

  • Переговори з міжнародними контрагентами.

  • Формування стандартизованої договірної архітектури для продуктів компанії.

2. Корпоративні та міжнародні юридичні процеси

  • Супровід реєстрації компаній у різних юрисдикціях (ЄС, UK, Мальта тощо).

  • Підготовка документів для відкриття банківських, PSP/EMI та merchant accounts.

  • Взаємодія з corporate service providers і зовнішніми юридичними радниками.

3. Compliance & regulatory support

  • Участь у KYC/KYB онбордингах до банків і платіжних систем.

  • Підготовка legal packages для compliance reviews.

  • Ідентифікація юридичних ризиків та пропозиція mitigations.

  • Підтримка внутрішніх політик (AML/KYC/Compliance) у межах юридичної компетенції.

4. Ліцензійні проєкти

  • Участь у процесах отримання фінансових ліцензій (FCA, MFSA, інші юрисдикції).

  • Підготовка частини документації, комунікація з консультантами та регуляторами.
    (Ви не ведете ліцензію самостійно — це зона відповідальності Head of Legal.)

5. Взаємодія з внутрішніми командами

  • Payments, Compliance, Finance, Business Development, Tech.

  • Юридичний супровід продуктів та операційних процесів.

  • Менторинг junior-колег (за потреби).

Очікування від кандидата

  • Високий рівень самоорганізації та ініціативності

  • Досвід роботи у high-risk fintech середовищі або готовність швидко адаптуватися.

  • Комфорт у середовищі, де одночасно ведуться міжнародні юридичні, комплаєнс та операційні процеси.

  • Аналітичне мислення, negotiation skills.

  • Англійська - Upper-Intermediate або вище (усна та письмова).

  • Можливість періодично виїжджати за межі України для участі у міжнародних конференціях, зустрічах з партнерами та внутрішніх офлайн-івентах.

Вимоги до досвіду

Обов’язково

  • 3+ років досвіду у фінтехі / банкінгу / PSP / міжнародних транзакціях.

  • Досвід роботи з міжнародними договорами.

  • Корпоративна юридична практика або участь у реєстрації компаній.

  • Досвід банківських або PSP онбордингів.

  • Розуміння AML/KYC/KYB процесів.

  • Досвід взаємодії з міжнародними юридичними радниками.

  • Участь у ліцензійних або регуляторних проєктах (будь-які юрисдикції).

Буде перевагою

  • Досвід у криптопроєктах або платіжній інфраструктурі.

  • Знання GDPR / DPA / UK Data Protection.

  • Досвід побудови юридичної функції з нуля.

  • Brand protection / IP.

  • Досвід роботи з фондами або венчуром.

Що пропонує компанія

  • Робота в інноваційній AI-driven fintech-екосистемі.

  • Вплив на ключову юридичну та фінансову інфраструктуру.

  • Міжнародні проєкти, високий рівень автономії.

  • Сильна професійна команда та підтримка Head of Legal.

  • Remote-first формат та гнучкий графік.

  • Можливість брати участь у міжнародних конференціях та бізнес-зустрічах.

Формат роботи

  • Повністю remote (глобальна команда).

  • Повна зайнятість.

  • Готовність до нерегулярних коротких закордонних відряджень (конференції, партнерські івенти).

  • Пряма взаємодія з Head of Legal та CEO.

raw.title: Part-Time Publishing & Editorial Assistant
raw.excerpt: Part-Time Publishing & Editorial Assistant (Optometry Student – up to 20 hrs/week)Remote | Flexible Hours | Paid | Ideal for Optometry Students Eyes On Eyecare is seeking a detail-oriented, motivated Publishing & Editorial Assistant to support our content and news operations.
raw.description:
Part-Time Publishing & Editorial Assistant (Optometry Student – up to 20 hrs/week)

Remote | Flexible Hours | Paid | Ideal for Optometry Students

Eyes On Eyecare is seeking a detail-oriented, motivated Publishing & Editorial Assistant to support our content and news operations. This role is perfect for optometry students looking to deepen their industry knowledge while gaining hands-on experience in medical publishing, writing, and digital content management.

What You’ll Do

  • Write short news briefs, articles, or interview-based pieces that align with our editorial guidelines and SEO best practices.
  • Develop cheat sheets, differential diagnosis guides, and other study guides to accompany clinical content.
  • Support the development of CE/CME lecture materials for our live and enduring education.
  • Research updates to optometry school programs, licensing requirements, CE rules, and other annual changes—then revise our content accordingly.
  • Verify citations and references in clinical articles.

What You’ll Be Working On

You’ll work on a wide range of optometry and ophthalmology content, including:

  • Clinical cheat sheets, differential diagnosis guides, and tutorials
  • Career articles, surveys, and practice management content
  • 300-word industry news briefs
  • Educational pieces developed from research or interviews with doctors and key opinion leaders

Qualifications

Required:

  • Must be a current or recently graduated Optometry student
  • Strong written communication skills and close attention to detail
  • Ability to work at least 2 hours between 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM ET for training and collaboration (remaining hours are fully flexible)
  • Enthusiasm for staying informed about eyecare industry trends
  • At least 10 hours and up to 20 hours of availability per week

Preferred:

  • Experience in content writing, editing, or publishing—especially in medical or marketing settings
  • 1+ years of experience in editing, proofreading, data entry, or similar
  • Familiarity with Google Docs, Sheets, & Looker Studio

title: .NET Developer
description: Boldare is an Agile-powered company with nearly two decades of international experience in product development and consulting.

raw.title: .NET Developer
raw.excerpt: Boldare is an Agile-powered company with nearly two decades of international experience in product development and consulting.
raw.description:
Boldare is an Agile-powered company with nearly two decades of international experience in product development and consulting. We help our clients redefine their industries by co-creating digital products their users truly need. Since 2004, Boldare has delivered over 300 solutions for clients across the globe — from Western and Northern Europe to the UK, North America, the Middle East, Southeast Asia, and Australia. Our 80+ specialists work fully remotely across Europe, combining technical excellence with a strong product mindset.

Currently, we’re looking for a .NET Developer to join a new, long-term project for one of our international clients. This is a strategic greenfield initiative, focused on building a high-quality integration platform from scratch. The system will handle millions of users across three key regions (US, UK, EU), integrating with platforms such as Salesforce Commerce Cloud (SFCC), CrowdTwist, and Amplience CMS.

What you'll be working on

  • Building a scalable, high-availability integration system

  • Designing and developing RESTful APIs

  • Collaborating with architects and other developers in a distributed team

  • Maintaining clean, testable, and well-documented code

  • Contributing to long-term platform stability and quality

Technical Requirements (must-have)

  • Minimum 3 years of experience working with C# and .NET (Core 9)

  • Very good knowledge of Web API (REST) and designing controllers and services

  • Familiarity with Clean Architecture (layered application architecture)

  • Experience with Entity Framework Core and relational databases (e.g., SQL Server, PostgreSQL)

  • Experience in asynchronous programming (async/await)

  • Knowledge of Git version control system

  • Ability to debug applications

  • Writing unit tests

  • English and Polish at minimum B2 level

Nice to have

  • Knowledge of Snowflake, Redis, GraphQL, or Amplience CMS

  • Experience with middleware, system integrations, and building API proxies

  • Understanding of API versioning, caching, and contract-first development

  • Knowledge of AWS (especially API Gateway, Secrets Manager, Beanstalk, WAF)

  • Hands-on experience with CI/CD (Bitbucket Pipelines, GitHub Actions, or similar)

Soft Skills

  • Independence in problem-solving and focus on code quality

  • Ability to read and understand existing architecture

  • Strong communication skills – collaboration within a project team (developers + architect)

  • Openness to code reviews and adherence to agreed coding conventions

  • Willingness to grow and stay updated on .NET ecosystem developments


🤖 AI-friendly recruitment & culture

At Boldare, we believe in using technology to amplify human potential. That’s why we encourage candidates to use AI tools (like ChatGPT, Copilot, Notion AI, etc.) even during the recruitment process – if they help you structure your thoughts, reflect, or communicate more clearly, go for it.

We’re curious to see how you think, not how fast you type.

Interested? Let’s build something meaningful together.

This role is focused on new account acquisition, leveraging existing buyer and distributor relationships, and expanding the company’s footprint in the West Coast. This is a fully remote position. Only U.S. based candidates will be considered.

Die isolutions freut sich auf dich!

title: Senior ClickHouse Engineer
description: About MoralisMoralis is redefining how businesses access blockchain data.

raw.title: Senior ClickHouse Engineer
raw.excerpt: About MoralisMoralis is redefining how businesses access blockchain data.
raw.description:
About Moralis

Moralis is redefining how businesses access blockchain data. Our APIs, streaming tools, and multi-chain integrations help developers and enterprises build Web3 applications faster, cheaper, and at scale. We’re a lean, global team with a big mission: to become the go-to data layer for the decentralized internet.

Role Overview

We’re looking for a dedicated and experienced ClickHouse DBA to take full ownership of our analytical database infrastructure. As more of our product shifts to ClickHouse, we need a specialist who can keep our clusters fast, reliable, and cost-efficient. You’ll partner closely with our backend and infra teams, enabling them to move faster while ensuring the database remains rock solid.

What You’ll Do

Cluster Operations

  • Manage and scale ClickHouse clusters (replication, sharding, distributed tables).
  • Handle schema evolution, partitioning strategies, and TTLs.
  • Maintain data consistency across replicas and shards.
  • Plan and execute upgrades with zero or minimal downtime.

Performance & Optimization

  • Profile and optimize heavy queries and table engines.
  • Tune key configs (max_threads, max_memory_usage, merge settings, I/O schedulers).
  • Benchmark cluster performance (ingest throughput, query latency, merge rate).
  • Work with engineers to optimize schema and query patterns.

Monitoring & Reliability

  • Maintain observability stack: Prometheus, Grafana, and system logs.
  • Set up alerting on query performance, merges, replicas, and disk usage.
  • Own backup and restore processes (S3, NFS, or local snapshots).
  • Test and document disaster recovery scenarios.

What We’re Looking For

  • 2+ years hands-on ClickHouse experience and 4+ years working as a DBA with distributed or analytical databases.
  • Strong understanding of replication, partitioning, and distributed table design.
  • Experience with performance tuning and large-scale OLAP workloads.
  • Familiarity with observability stacks (Prometheus/Grafana).
  • Hands-on experience managing production clusters with high uptime requirements.
  • Comfortable taking full ownership of mission-critical systems.

Nice-to-Have

  • Experience with multi-cluster or cross-region setups.
  • Familiarity with ClickHouse Cloud or Altinity.Cloud.
  • Experience using S3/object storage as part of a ClickHouse deployment.
  • Background in Druid, Pinot, BigQuery, Snowflake, or similar OLAP systems.
  • Contributions to ClickHouse open source.

Who You Are

  • Deeply detail-oriented and passionate about performance and reliability.
  • Comfortable working remotely and asynchronously in a fast-paced environment.
  • Proactive about improving infrastructure, automation, and data quality.
  • Excited to work in the Web3/data space and learn new technologies.

What We Offer

  • Compensation: Competitive part-time engagement with flexible hours and the ability to convert to full-time as the role evolves.
  • Ownership: You’ll own our ClickHouse infrastructure end-to-end.
  • Culture: Remote-first, async-friendly, and product-led team distributed across Europe and beyond.

Our client, a specialised Pinterest Ads Agency, is on the hunt for a seasoned Pinterest Ads Expert to join their vibrant team for a full time remote job.

We specialize in crafting leading advertising strategies that deliver exceptional results for our clients. We're on a mission to help businesses thrive! We value accountability, creativity, and hard-work, and we reward high achievers fairly.

The role demands a professional adept at utilizing Pinterest to escalate brand visibility, foster website traffic, and amplify overall sales for our clients. We are seeking a candidate deeply familiar with Pinterests infrastructure, equipped with a strategic mindset, and capable of steering a successful path in the ever-evolving landscape of digital marketing.

Responsibilities:

  • Conduct comprehensive audits of existing accounts to identify areas of opportunity and optimization.
  • Design and execute Pinterest advertising strategies that align with our clients' objectives and KPIs.
  • Develop visually appealing Pinterest ad campaigns with engaging content.
  • Supervise and manage campaigns to achieve a 70% increase in website traffic and click-through rates over a span of 3 months.

  • Proactively explore trends, new campaign ideas, and new marketing methods
  • Work to improve clients brand presence
  • Work towards achieving an 1.5x increase in return on ad spend (ROAS), and a 2x increase in revenue with ROAS exceeding the goal ROAS.

Qualifications:

  • Background in Marketing, Advertising, or a relevant field.
  • 2+ years of deep-seated experience in social media advertising on Pinterest and/or other social media marketing platforms, with a focus on maximizing ROI.
  • Expert knowledge of Pinterest Ads Manager and other pertinent tools.
  • A portfolio depicting a history of successful Pinterest ad campaigns.
    Nice to have:
  • Pinterest Ads Certification.
  • Mastery of photo editing tools such as Photoshop.

About you:

We're looking for someone who embodies the following qualities:

  • Effective communication: Ability to convey ideas and results clearly.
  • Time management: Skill in prioritizing tasks and meeting deadlines independently.
  • Analytical thinking: Proficiency in analyzing data to make informed decisions.
  • Creativity & Strategy: Capability to audit, set up, and implement the right strategy to optimize and grow accounts.

If you're a Social Media Ads Specialist ready to make a significant impact in the world of social media advertising, we encourage you to apply and join our team at Pinclever. Together, we'll elevate brands and drive success in the digital marketing arena!

raw.title: Junior 2D Motion Designer
raw.excerpt: Про компанію:BetterMe — глобальна wellness-екосистема, що створює продукти для фізичного, ментального та емоційного балансу.
raw.description:
Про компанію:

BetterMe — глобальна wellness-екосистема, що створює продукти для фізичного, ментального та емоційного балансу. Ми допомагаємо мільйонам людей ставати кращими — і зростаємо разом із ними.

Наразі шукаємо Junior 2D Motion Designer для створення яскравих анімаційних роликів для соцмереж. У команді ти навчишся працювати з анімацією та відео для різних платформ, освоїш інструменти та техніки Motion Design, матимеш можливість обмінюватися знаннями та отримувати зворотній зв’язок від колег.
За останній рік команда значно зросла, і ми продовжуємо активно розширюватися, відкриваючи можливості для навчання та професійного розвитку.

Твої майбутні задачі:

  • Працювати з готовими проєктами (колектами);
  • Створювати рекламні креативи за брифом;
  • Адаптувати відео під різні платформи та локалізації.

Що для цього тобі знадобиться?

  • Впевнене володіння інструментами After Effects;
  • Розуміння базових принципів анімації та вміння налаштовувати графіки швидкості;
  • Вміння працювати з шейпами та масками;
  • Досвід роботи з будь-якими плагінами;
  • Pre-intermediate+ рівень володіння англійською мовою;
  • Уважність, вміння швидко навчатися та організувати свій робочий процес.

Буде круто, якщо ти маєш:

  • Досвід роботи у сфері дизайну;
  • Знання плагінів RedGiant, Stardust, Animation Composer та інших;
  • Розуміння нейромереж Midjourney, Stable Diffusion.

Що на тебе чекає в BetterMe:

Місія, що надихає. Кожен наш код, дизайн, ідея допомагають мільйонам людей ставати здоровішими і впевненішими.
Довіра без мікроменеджменту. Ти самостійно керуєш своїм часом і приймаєш рішення. Ми цінуємо результат, а не години онлайн.
Можливості росту. 90% наших лідів виросли всередині компанії. Є простір для ініціатив, нових обов’язків і кар’єрного апґрейду.
Зручний формат роботи. Можливість працювати повністю віддалено.
Відкрита комунікація. Прозорість між командами, чесний фідбек і підтримка ініціатив — наша звична практика

Дізнайся більше про нас: Instagram, LinkedIn.

title: US Accountant
description: Location: Remote (Work from Home) Employment Type: Full-time Work Schedule: U.

raw.title: US Accountant
raw.excerpt: Location: Remote (Work from Home) Employment Type: Full-time Work Schedule: U.
raw.description:
Location: Remote (Work from Home)
Employment Type: Full-time
Work Schedule: U.S. Business Hours

About Us

At OurAssistants, we connect businesses with top-tier Virtual Assistants (VAs) to streamline operations and boost productivity. We specialize in matching skilled professionals to diverse industries, ensuring a seamless and efficient remote work experience. Join our growing team and be part of a company that values excellence, innovation, and collaboration. Learn more at ourassistants.com.

About the Role

We are seeking an experienced Accountant with expertise in property management accounting. The ideal candidate is a U.S. Certified Management Accountant (CMA) with at least 3+ years of senior-level accounting experience in the real estate/property management industry, including direct U.S. accounting experience.

This role is client-facing, requiring excellent communication skills to collaborate with property owners, managers, and stakeholders while ensuring accurate financial management.

Key Responsibilities

  • Oversee and manage daily accounting operations for property management portfolios.

  • Prepare and review financial statements, monthly reports, and variance analyses.

  • Handle bank, tenant ledger, and general ledger reconciliations.

  • Ensure full compliance with U.S. GAAP and property management accounting standards.

  • Communicate directly with clients, providing financial updates and addressing inquiries.

  • Collaborate with property managers, owners, and external auditors.

  • Support budgeting, forecasting, and cash flow management.

  • Identify opportunities for process improvement and implement best practices.

Qualifications

  • U.S. Certified Management Accountant (CMA) preferred.

  • Minimum 3 years of U.S. accounting experience (must-have).

  • At least 3 years of senior-level accounting experience in property management.

  • Strong knowledge of accounting software and property management systems (e.g., AppFolio, Yardi, Buildium).

  • Proven client communication and relationship management skills.

  • Excellent analytical, organizational, and communication skills.

  • Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced remote environment.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience managing multi-property portfolios or working with HOAs/real estate/property management firms.

  • Advanced Excel skills and familiarity with financial reporting tools.

  • CPA or additional certifications are a strong advantage.

title: Fenimore Kay Harrison LLP Executive Assistant
description: Please Note: This job is being posted on behalf of Chet Fenimore (https://www.

raw.title: Fenimore Kay Harrison LLP Executive Assistant
raw.excerpt: Please Note: This job is being posted on behalf of Chet Fenimore (https://www.
raw.description:
Please Note: This job is being posted on behalf of Chet Fenimore (https://www.fkhpartners.com) by Great Assistant (www.greatassistant.com). Great Assistant is a company that works with entrepreneurs to match them to assistants.

Chet Fenimore is the Chairman of Fenimore Kay Harrison LLP, a nationally recognized boutique law firm focused exclusively on representing community banks. The firm advises banks across the United States on corporate, regulatory, and securities matters, with a strong emphasis on mergers and acquisitions. Fenimore Kay Harrison is a boutique law firm with deep specialization, a responsive approach, and a collaborative team environment.

We are seeking a calm, detail-oriented, and highly dependable Executive Assistant to support the Chairman in a professional legal environment. This role is well-suited for someone who values accuracy, confidentiality, and thoughtful communication, and who can manage multiple priorities with discretion. You must be aligned with the following Core Values:

  • Client-Focused, Strategic Excellence
  • Exceptional Value & Responsiveness
  • Deep Community Banking Expertise
  • Collaboration, Accountability & Teamwork
  • Grow Together – People First

This position plays a critical role in keeping communication, scheduling, and priorities organized so the Chairman can stay focused on client work and firm leadership. The ideal assistant is able to manage details independently, keep information moving, and ensure follow-through across day-to-day work.

Some of your responsibilities will include:

  • Managing a high-volume email inbox (100+ emails per day) and prioritizing messages appropriately
  • Calendar management and meeting coordination
  • Coordinating multi-state travel and related logistics
  • Supporting and coordinating speaking engagements and presentations
  • Assisting with billing support and expense reimbursements
  • Business development follow-up and professional correspondence
  • Tracking tasks and projects to ensure deadlines are met and work stays on track
  • Drafting and sending emails on behalf of the Chairman
  • Light document and Word processing cleanup
  • Research and preparation support for meetings and calls
  • Pulling documents and information needed for client interactions
  • Assisting with PowerPoint and business presentation preparation

Success in this role requires strong organizational instincts and the ability to think ahead. This is not a task-by-task role, but a support partnership built on trust, consistency, and sound judgment. If you enjoy working in a structured, professional environment and take pride in doing things carefully and correctly, this role offers long-term stability and a strong working relationship built on trust.

In addition to the above, the ideal candidate must be/have:

  • Friendly, professional, outgoing, caring, and team-oriented
  • Exceptional attention to detail and a high level of accuracy
  • Highly organized with the ability to manage multiple priorities calmly and with ease
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Able to take initiative and work independently while keeping others informed
  • Assertive but balanced, not overly aggressive or passive
  • Proactive, with the ability to think ahead and anticipate needs
  • A sense of urgency around completing work and following through
  • Good common sense with sound judgment
  • Highly trustworthy, with the ability to handle confidential information with discretion
  • Calm, steady, and thoughtful in a professional environment
  • Reliable, consistent, dependable, and collaborative
  • Comfortable keeping leadership informed without overcommunicating
  • Able to support big-picture priorities while managing details day to day
  • You must be tech savvy and quick to pick up new tools and software

Experience with the following tools is a plus!

  • ﻿Microsoft Office Suite
  • Microsoft Outlook
  • Microsoft Teams
  • iManage
  • Clio

Position Details

  • ﻿This is a remote W2 Employee position
  • The position will be 40 hours per week
  • Benefits include medical, PTO, sick time, paid holidays, a 401(k) with match, and a discretionary bonus based on performance
  • Flexible schedule within 8:00 am – 5:00 pm CST
  • The annual salary for this position is $75,000 USD
  • You must be able to pass a background check
  • We are looking for someone to become a long-term (3+ years) team member

**Please do not contact Chet Fenimore or Fenimore Kay Harrison LLP directly; doing so will disqualify your application***
