raw.title: Chief Operations Officer (Equity-Based)
raw.excerpt: Position: Chief Operations Officer Location: Remote Category: Flexible, Part-time (15 hours) to Full-time (40 hours) Compensation: Fair Market Value, Equity-Based Compensation Model Welcome to the forefront of transformational change.
raw.description:
Position: Chief Operations Officer
Location: Remote
Category: Flexible, Part-time (15 hours) to Full-time (40 hours)
Compensation: Fair Market Value, Equity-Based Compensation Model

Welcome to the forefront of transformational change. At SOULCHI, we are driven by a vision that blends virtues-based leadership, conscious growth, and a commitment to the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals. As an equity-based startup team member, you're not just joining a team; you're embarking on a journey to shape a more harmonious and sustainable world. We believe that true progress stems from the fusion of innovation and values, and that's exactly what you'll find here – a dynamic environment where your talents will thrive, your ideas will flourish, and your impact will resonate far beyond. Join us in rewriting the narrative of leadership and making a lasting difference that echoes through generations.

Responsibilities:.

Operational Leadership:

At SOULCHI, we're not just building an app; we're crafting a revolution that combines virtues and technology to spark positive global transformation. As our COO, you'll:

  • Lead employees to encourage maximum performance and dedication.
  • Evaluate performance by analyzing and interpreting data and metrics.

    • Collaboration:

  • Collaborate with the CEO in setting and driving organizational vision, operational strategy, and hiring needs in Year 1 OKRs, 3-year vision, and 10-year goals
  • Act as a liaison between company staff and the executive team.
  • Orchestrate seamless collaboration between our Product Design Team and other divisions.

    • Strategic Planning:

  • Design and implement business strategies, plans, and procedures
  • Set comprehensive goals for performance and growth

    • Financial Performance:

  • With our CFO, oversee the company's financial performance, investments, and other business ventures.
  • Develop and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics to measure operational efficiency and effectiveness.

    • Qualifications:

    • Proven experience as a Chief Operating Officer or relevant role.
    • Demonstrable competency in strategic planning and business development.
    • Experience in fundraising will be a plus.
    • Excellent interpersonal and leadership skills.
    • Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
    • Outstanding organizational and leadership abilities.
    • Excellent communication and public speaking skills.
    • Knowledge of data analysis and performance/operation metrics.
    • Understanding of business functions such as HR, Finance, marketing, etc.
    • Experience in a start-up environment a plus

    Equity-Based Compensation Opportunity:

    As part of the SOULCHI team, you'll take part in our equity-based compensation model, aligning your success with the success of our business. After much research, we have found the fairest equity model for a startup. We use the Slicing Pie model. The first phase is equity-based only, which we are currently in. Equity calculations move dynamically based on your fair market rate and actual number of hours worked. In the second phase, which happens at the break-even point, the equity freezes at each member's current earned percentage, and compensation switches to salary + benefits. Your equity percentage gets paid out annually as part of the profit sharing. This is more than a job; it's an opportunity to own a piece of the future.

    We request you only apply for this position if you believe an equity-based model is the perfect fit for you. A more detailed explanation from the professor who created the model can be found on Youtube, "Pie Slicer Equity Split Software" by Slicing Pie.

    We understand the importance of work-life balance and recognize that each individual has unique scheduling needs. As such, we offer flexibility in working hours for the Chief Operations Officer role, with the opportunity to work anywhere between 15 to 40 hours per week, depending on the candidate's availability and suitability for the role.

    Thank you for considering SOULCHI as your future employer.

    How to Apply: To apply, please submit your resume and a cover letter detailing your alignment with our mission and the value you can bring to our team. Join our passionate team and be part of a transformative journey to spread virtues, create social impact, and contribute to a more loving and peaceful world. Together, we can harness the power of technology to bring the truth of oneness to the center of societies worldwide.

The Role

Remote - Contractor - Part-time - WORKING TIME ZONE: GMT+3 (Singapore)

Nice to Have:

▪️Awareness or hands-on experience with Machine Learning, Agentic AI, or similar emerging technologies.

▪️Experience using AI-powered code generation tools to enhance development speed and MVP creation.

title: Case Manager  (Acutes) / RN
description: Scope: The Case Manager manages an individual caseload using the case management process in order to meet the needs of the MedWatch, LLC customers and consumers.

raw.title: Case Manager  (Acutes) / RN
raw.excerpt: Scope: The Case Manager manages an individual caseload using the case management process in order to meet the needs of the MedWatch, LLC customers and consumers.
raw.description:
Scope:
The Case Manager manages an individual caseload using the case management process in order to meet the needs of the MedWatch, LLC customers and consumers. This includes, but is not limited to, authorization of services, review of treatment plans for medical necessity, standards of care, and ongoing communication with all members of the health care team. This is a remote/work-from-home position. This position required you to be licensed in ALL 50 States ( that includes states not included in the compact license.)

License Requirements:
  • Being licensed in ALL 50 States including states not included with the compact license
  • Registered Nurse (current active and unrestricted, in state of current practice and residence, within the United States or its territories.)
Education:
  • R.N., a bachelor’s degree in a health-related field preferred.
Experience:
  • 7 years of varied clinical experience preferred.
Responsibilities:
  • The Registered Nurse Case Manager will practice within the scope of his/her licensure.
  • Review all medical data which can be provided to establish, update and maintain accountability for a case management plan which will incorporate contact with providers, payers, with the patient and with the patient’s primary caregiver.
  • Assess problems and determine goals and actions designed to meet the needs of the patient and document into the case notes. Determine if these goals are long term or short term and how the patient can be expected to meet those goals. Include the action/intervention the case manager will take to work towards achieving those goals.
  • Make contact with the payer office to find out and understand any benefit constraints that will have an impact on the plan of action.
  • Proceed with contacting medical care providers and with equipment vendors to verify medical necessity of care or equipment that has been ordered.
  • Make care arrangements for quality patient care according to the needs of the patient, the physician’s orders and the benefits available.
  • The Case Manager will work in conjunction with the Case Management Assistant to manage case management files, exclusive of Assessment and/or Care Plan activities, and will provide input in the Annual Performance Evaluation of the CM Assistant assigned. The Case Manager will maintain responsibility for the Case Management file.
  • Be aware of any alternative treatment possibilities that may allow the patient to reach wellness goal(s). If there are no benefits available for your recommended alternative treatments, provide to the payer a cost-benefit analysis to demonstrate that extra-contractual services will enhance the patient’s medical condition and will be cost-effective to the benefit plan.
  • Become familiar with community resources and funding sources so that the patient can receive quality health care and conserve health benefit dollars. Many agencies exist which provide assistance to persons in financial need or to provide information to persons with specific medical conditions.
  • Maintain case in computer system documenting case actions for each patient under your case management. Complete all aspects of case in the computer. Prepare timely reports to the payer to detail all case actions, the results of those actions, and the continuing case management plan.
  • Maintain billing as appropriate in computer system.
  • Continue to maintain contact with the providers and with the patient across the continuum of care to be sure that patient needs are being met. On any cases which include a chronic condition keep the file open for periodic contacts to verify the clinical status of the patient and additional medical needs.
  • Negotiate with providers to maximize the medical benefits available to the patient. Make network referral as appropriate.
  • Act upon any awareness of non-medical issues which involve the patient’s safety or welfare. Attempt to direct the patient or family to appropriate providers or community resources, or to personally notify appropriate authorities. Consult with the CM supervisor on a regular basis, and keep the supervisor informed regarding any complaints which may occur about case management services or any issues which arise which the case manager is not competent to handle or does not have the expertise to handle.
  • Adhere to all company policies as stated in the employee handbook.
  • All case managers will possess a URAC-recognized certification in Case Management within 3 years of hire. Participate in the Quality Management Program by adhering to all company policies and procedures and identifying opportunities for improvement to ensure quality services are rendered to clients and customers.
  • This position is eligible for a bonus program.
The salary range for this position is from $72,000 to $81,000 annually.

Work Environment / Physical Demands: This position is in a typical home office environment which requires prolonged sitting in front of a computer. Requires hand-eye coordination and manual dexterity sufficient to operate standard office equipment including operation of standard computer and phone equipment.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability/veterans.

Our client, a well-established multinational multi-brand D2C e-commerce company operating in the USA is looking for an experienced accountant/financial manager professional to fill an immediate opening for a Financial Manager for a full-time remote job.

Your main goal is to build and maintain the financial operational processes of the company, which will improve financial monitoring, accountability and growths, and assure preparation of financial reports for legal entities of the company.

Do you have professional experience in accounting, financial (management) reporting, planning, and control for an e-commerce company? We would love to hear from you!

About You:

  • You are aware of a companys financial workflow improvement and business priorities determination through a well-organized, systematic, automated approach
  • You have at least 2 years of experience managing books in QuickBooks or Xero (or similar)
  • You have proven experience managing finances for an e-commerce company (preferably operating in USA or Europe)
  • Strong expertise in the field of management accounting; experience in building management accounting and adjustments for changing conditions
  • Experience is setting up accounting standards within the company
  • Advanced Excel (Google Sheet) skills

Will be a plus:

  • Knowledge of USA tax law, US sales tax system
  • Experience of working in a company selling on Amazon.
  • Bookkeeping experience in the USA/Europe

Your Tasks Will Include:

  • Organization and control of accounting in a group of companies in order to obtain complete and reliable information about financial and economic activities
  • General bookkeeping for companies' entities (USA, Europe)
  • Control of management accounting and preparation of consolidated reports for all entities on a recurring basis: P CF, project marginality, Balance, etc.
  • Review financial reports and advise corrective action accordingly.
  • Collect and analyze data to prepare financial forecasts and suggest strategies to address challenges and leverage strengths.
  • Analyze revenue, expenses, cash flows, and balance sheets to optimize profitability and transparency.
  • Assists and supports upper-level management to ensure sound financial decision-making that is in the long-term best interest of the organizational mission.
  • Control and optimization of operational processes of the financial team.
  • Oversee bill payment/accounts payable and expense reporting
  • Look for ways to cut costs without impairing the long-term financial health of the organization.
  • Automation of department workflows and optimization of existing financial processes.

Benefits:

  • Work for a Market-proven, fast-growing company
  • Competitive salary and bonus opportunities
  • Friendly International start-up environment
  • Paid trainings and courses
  • Be a part of something bigger, where you can have autonomy over your work
  • Fully remote work and flexible working hours (work from whatever place)

raw.description:
Job Title: Mechanical Engineering Intern — Hardware Production & Design

Department: Hardware Production & Field Operations

Reports To: Head of Hardware Production & Field Operations

Work Location: Nairobi (frequent travel to field sites and workshop/fabrication partners)

Employment Type: Internship (6 months, with 3-month probation)

Monthly Stipend: KES 20,000 gross

About the Role
Synnefa🌱 is an innovative ag-tech startup dedicated to transforming agriculture through smart, climate-resilient solutions. We provide end-to-end solutions that integrate solar driers, smart greenhouses, FarmShield IoT sensors, and FarmCloud record-keeping software to enhance farming efficiency, sustainability, and profitability. Our mission is to empower farmers with technology that simplifies farming and increases incomes.

We are seeking a Mechanical Engineering Intern to support our Hardware Production & Field Operations team. This is a hands-on role designed for a motivated early-career engineer seeking real-world exposure to hardware production, procurement coordination, CAD, and field installations.

The intern will support day-to-day BOQ/BOM processing, supplier coordination, simple CAD work, and field support, helping the team improve build speed, quality, and delivery timelines. This role offers a strong learning pipeline toward a future Design/Production Engineering position.

Key Responsibilities

  • BOQ/BOM Processing & Supplier Coordination;

Support incoming BOQs/BQs, populate and maintain standard BOQ templates, manage master BOMs, and maintain supplier price registers, including landed-cost calculations. Prepare RFQs and supplier comparison tables for review and approval.

  • Procurement Follow-up & Vendor Management;
    Track supplier lead times, maintain vendor records, log quality feedback, flag procurement risks early, and assist with purchase order preparation.
  • CAD & Parts/BOM Development (Learning Role);
    Create simple subassembly models and part drawings using Fusion 360 or AutoCAD. Maintain CAD file structure, naming conventions, and revisions, and ensure alignment between CAD models and BOMs.
  • Fabrication Drawings, SOPs & QA Documentation;
    Under supervision, assist in developing basic fabrication drawings, assembly SOPs, QA checklists, and documentation for pilot builds and small subassemblies.
  • Field Support & Continuous Improvement;
    Participate in installations and pilot builds, capture site feedback, document issues or failure modes, and feed improvements back into CAD, BOMs, and SOPs.
  • Documentation & Cross-functional Communication;
    Maintain clear, accurate records, provide weekly progress updates, and participate in mentoring and review sessions with the hardware and technical development teams.

Qualifications & Requirements

  • Diploma or Degree in Mechanical, Manufacturing, Industrial, Production Engineering, or equivalent hands-on fabrication experience
    • 0–2 years of experience (internships, early graduate roles, or workshop experience)
    • Exposure to fabrication workshops, structural projects, agri-equipment, construction, or field operations is an advantage
    • Basic CAD experience (Fusion360 or AutoCAD) or strong willingness to learn quickly
    • Comfortable using Excel or Google Sheets for cost and BOM tracking
    • Familiarity with basic fabrication concepts such as welding, steel profiles, and BOM structures
    • Willingness to travel to field and workshop sites on short notice
    • Valid driver’s license is an added advantage but not required
    • Strong communication, organisation, and documentation skills

How to apply

Submit your CV together with a short portfolio or examples of past work where available (photos of fabrication work, CAD screenshots, brief BOQ examples). Applications without a portfolio may not be considered for shortlisting

Equal Employment Opportunity:

Synnefa🌱 is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. We strongly encourage individuals from underrepresented groups to apply, and we strive to make all employment decisions based on merit, potential, and company needs.

Disclaimer:

We want to give everyone a fair shot at joining us, so we encourage all applicants to use our synnefa.breezy.hr applicant tracking system-ATS to apply for any openings at Synnefa and avoid contacting Synnefa employees or management about the opening.

Any attempt to contact us or any Synnefa team member, especially management, through unofficial means, including whatsapp chats, direct emails, phone calls, or social media messages, will result in automatic disqualification from the application process.

We appreciate your understanding and cooperation in maintaining a fair and orderly recruitment process.

Mercor is partnering with a cutting-edge AI research initiative to generate high-quality Excel-based training data for financial modeling. We’re seeking experienced finance specialists with deep Excel expertise to help synthesize realistic, structurally complex spreadsheets across key financial domains. This short-term, project-based engagement offers a unique opportunity to contribute domain knowledge to frontier model development.

Ideal Qualifications

More About the Opportunity

  • Expected time commitment: ~10h/week

  • Project duration: 1 week (with possibility for extension)

Salesforce Consultant

Join a dynamic Salesforce-obsessed consultancy solving complex client challenges

Remote (South Africa) | R50 000 to R75 000 (Dependent on experience) | UK hours (8 am - 5 pm, flexible)

About Our Client

This is not your typical consultancy. With a team deeply passionate about Salesforce, the company is committed to delivering smart, impactful solutions that clients love while also placing real emphasis on employee wellbeing. Every team member is valued, supported, and encouraged to thrive in a collaborative, enjoyable work environment.

The Role: Salesforce Consultant

As a Salesforce Consultant, you'll take the lead in delivering tailored Salesforce solutions that align with client goals. From requirement gathering to solution design, configuration, training, and ongoing support, you'll own the full project lifecycle, ensuring client satisfaction at every step. You'll also work across multiple clouds, including CPQ and Revenue Operations, where relevant.

Key Responsibilities

  • Minimum 3 years experience as a Salesforce Functional Consultant
  • Act as the primary client contact for business analysis and solution mapping
  • Gather and validate functional and technical requirements
  • Design and implement Salesforce solutions, including CPQ and RevOps where applicable
  • Configure and customise Salesforce to meet client specifications
  • Manage data migration from legacy systems
  • Develop and carry out test plans to ensure solution quality
  • Deliver user training and support for adoption
  • Create detailed documentation, including process flows and user guides
  • Support project management, timelines, and issue resolution
  • Provide post-implementation support and recommend enhancements

About You

  • 3+ years Salesforce consulting experience with successful implementations
  • Broad knowledge of Salesforce products, including Sales, Service, Nonprofit Cloud, and CPQ/RevOps
  • Salesforce certifications preferred: Admin, Sales Cloud Consultant, Service Cloud Consultant, CPQ Specialist
  • Excellent client-facing, communication, and interpersonal skills
  • Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving ability
  • Able to work independently and collaboratively
  • Familiarity with project management methodologies

title: AI Solutions Architect 2026
description: Aimpoint Digital is a premier analytics consulting firm with a mission to drive business value for clients through expertise in data strategy, data analytics, decision sciences, and data engineering and infrastructure.

raw.title: AI Solutions Architect 2026
raw.excerpt: Aimpoint Digital is a premier analytics consulting firm with a mission to drive business value for clients through expertise in data strategy, data analytics, decision sciences, and data engineering and infrastructure.
raw.description:
Aimpoint Digital is a premier analytics consulting firm with a mission to drive business value for clients through expertise in data strategy, data analytics, decision sciences, and data engineering and infrastructure. We're a dynamic team committed to solving our client's most challenging business problems in partnership with the industry's most innovative software providers. This position is within our analytics strategy practice.

Who we are looking for and what you will do

We are looking for an experienced AI and analytics leader who combines strong strategic thinking with practical solution design skills. As an AI Solutions Architect, you will be part of our AI Strategy Practice, lead end-to-end AI strategy engagements and serve as a trusted advisor to senior stakeholders so that they can make informed recommendations on AI approaches, platforms, and architectures.

You will work at the intersection of business strategy, AI capabilities, and modern data platforms, helping clients translate AI ambition into scalable, governed, and value-driven solutions. You bring a strong understanding of AI and GenAI capabilities, enterprise data platforms, and analytics ecosystems, with the ability to design solution architectures, make recommendations on appropriate tooling and explain technical tradeoffs without needing to code or build models yourself. You can speak credibly with architects and engineers while remaining grounded in business outcomes and adoption.

You are an effective facilitator and communicator, capable of leading workshops, guiding decision-making, and presenting to executive audiences. You will be responsible for monitoring new trends emerging within GenAI and determine the impact to our overarching firm POV. You thrive in ambiguity, operate independently, and know how to balance strategy with actionable execution.

You have experience identifying and delivering AI use cases across functions and industries which deliver real, tangible value in an enterprise setting that can be easily measured and understood.

Key Responsibilities

  • Lead end-to-end AI strategy engagements, including engagement planning, client management, delivery execution, and executive readouts.
  • Lead AI and GenAI strategy workshops with business and technology stakeholders to identify, structure, and prioritize high-value use cases, with minimal oversight.
  • Assess client current-state data, analytics, and AI maturity across people, process, technology, and governance; synthesize findings into clear strategic implications and recommendations.
  • Define future-state AI capabilities, operating models, and governance frameworks that enable scalable, responsible, and value-driven AI adoption.
  • Act as the AI solution architect within strategy engagements by designing conceptual and logical AI architectures, identifying appropriate AI patterns, and guiding platform and tooling decisions.
  • Translate strategic intent into execution-ready artifacts, including AI roadmaps, use-case backlogs, reference architectures, and delivery sequencing plans.
  • Partner closely across practice teams to ensure alignment between strategy, solution design, and downstream implementation.
  • Evaluate technical options and tradeoffs and make informed recommendations grounded in business objectives.
  • Develop business cases and value frameworks that quantify the expected impact of AI initiatives and support investment decisions.
  • Lead executive-level communications, including steering committee updates, decision briefings, and final strategy readouts.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in business, Information Systems, Computer Science, Engineering, or related field; MBA or equivalent experience preferred.
  • 6+ years of experience in AI, analytics, data, or digital transformation roles, including consulting or enterprise advisory experience.
  • Proven experience leading client engagements independently, including planning, facilitation, delivery, and executive communication.
  • Strong working understanding of AI and GenAI solution patterns, analytics architectures, and modern data platform design using Snowflake, Databricks, AWS, Azure, or GCP.
  • Experience designing conceptual and logical AI architectures, operating models, and roadmaps that guide downstream implementation.
  • Ability to evaluate technical tradeoffs and make platform or approach recommendations aligned to business needs.
  • Excellent communication and storytelling skills, with experience presenting to senior executives.

We are actively seeking candidates for full-time, remote work within the US. Atlanta-based applicants will have the opportunity to work in our headquarters in Sandy Springs, GA.

Location: Work from Home
Type of Employment: Full-time

About Us

At OurAssistants, we connect logistics, property management, and service-based businesses with top-tier virtual professionals. We're committed to supporting our clients operations while creating a growth-focused, remote-friendly work environment for our team members. Learn more at ourassistants.com.

Job Title: Power Platform Specialist / Automation Business Analyst

About the Role

We’re looking for a Power Platform Specialist with strong experience in Power Automate, AI Studio, and Copilot Studio who can also act as a business analyst to work directly with our teams. This hybrid role is all about partnering with the business to understand their processes, identify automation opportunities, and deliver AI-powered solutions that make a real difference.

You’ll be the bridge between business stakeholders and technology, turning ideas into practical, scalable automations that improve efficiency and unlock new ways of working.

Responsibilities

  • Engage with business teams to understand workflows, pain points, and opportunities for automation.
  • Document requirements and translate them into automation and AI solution designs.
  • Build and deploy solutions using Power Automate, AI Studio, and Copilot Studio.
  • Prototype, test, and iterate with business users to ensure solutions meet real needs.
  • Maintain and support existing automations, ensuring reliability and compliance.
  • Act as a subject matter expert for the Power Platform, guiding teams on best practices.
  • Champion automation and AI adoption across the organization, including running workshops and demos.
  • Collaborate with IT/architecture teams to ensure solutions are secure, scalable, and aligned with governance.

Requirements

  • Proven experience with Microsoft Power Platform (Power Automate, AI Studio/AI Builder, Copilot Studio/Power Virtual Agents).
  • Strong business analysis skills – process mapping, requirements gathering, stakeholder engagement.
  • Hands-on experience developing, testing and delivering automation and AI solutions from concept to production.

Additional Requirements

  • Must be currently residing in the Philippines
  • Must have a stable internet connection and a remote-ready workstation

Compensation and Benefits

  • Competitive salary
  • Permanent remote work setup
  • Opportunities for professional development and learning
  • Collaborative and innovative team environment

raw.title: Wealth Advisor / Private Client Advisor
raw.excerpt: Mercor is hiring on behalf of a next-generation wealth advisory group that combines personalized financial planning with data-driven insights and AI-enhanced portfolio solutions.
raw.description:
Mercor is hiring on behalf of a next-generation wealth advisory group that combines personalized financial planning with data-driven insights and AI-enhanced portfolio solutions. We’re seeking an experienced Wealth Advisor / Private Client Advisor to build, retain, and grow relationships with high-net-worth (HNW) and ultra-high-net-worth (UHNW) clients through comprehensive financial planning and bespoke investment strategies.

Role Overview

You’ll serve as the primary advisor to a select group of clients, managing both financial plans and multi-asset investment portfolios. This is a remote, flexible (20–30 hrs/week) opportunity designed for seasoned advisors who excel at relationship management, asset allocation, and long-term strategy execution.

Responsibilities

  • Manage and deepen relationships with HNW and UHNW clients, delivering exceptional service and trust-based advice.

  • Develop and implement holistic financial and investment plans aligned with client goals, liquidity needs, and risk tolerance.

  • Conduct asset allocation, portfolio reviews, and performance evaluations.

  • Identify opportunities to grow client AUM through strategic referrals and value-driven engagement.

  • Collaborate with investment and planning teams to integrate AI insights, risk analytics, and digital portfolio tools.

  • Maintain a deep understanding of tax, estate, and retirement planning strategies.

Qualifications

  • 5+ years of experience in wealth management, private banking, or RIA environments.

  • Proven track record managing $20M+ in client assets.

  • Expertise in financial planning, portfolio construction, and client communication.

  • Strong interpersonal and relationship-building skills with a client-first mindset.

  • Knowledge of financial planning software, CRM systems, and investment platforms.

  • CFP, CFA, CPA, or MBA preferred.

Why Join

  • Flexible, 20–30 hour/week structure — ideal for experienced advisors balancing client work and strategic growth.

  • Work remotely with a global team transforming wealth management through AI and analytics.

  • Partner with innovative professionals across finance, data, and technology.

  • Gain access to cutting-edge portfolio tools and intelligence platforms to enhance client outcomes.

  • Build enduring client relationships with a focus on holistic, long-term financial success.
